Feeling numb I have realized that if I cannot talk to someone about my feeling then the next best thing is to write them down and seek advice from reddit so here I am. I am on campus right now preparing for my midterm and my confidence is at an all time low. I have not even seen the paper and already I feel a if I have lost. I never thought I would reach such a low in my life. Something weird happened today. I finally set up a countdown timer to the day my exam result are announced. That seemed like the next logical step and it made complete sense to me in a weird way. The only thing that made me remove that wa talking to my parent and seeing the hope and love for me in their eyes. I know my life is not truly mine and that if I hurt myself then I also hurt other people but it is just getting too much. The thought is always there in my mind and for the past few day that voice ha gotten stronger. I have been through this period before and had come out nearly unharmed and at the beginning of the year I wa feeling optimistic about what is to come but that lasted all of one month. The future I wa dreaming of look bleak and distant and with every passing minute that future keep on going farther and farther away from me. I try very hard to keep my guard up near people I know and love but it is becoming harder and harder to do so. I used to think that I wa destined to do some good in the world but maybe that wa just me being delusional. It is getting harder to keep the tear in. Whenever I used to feel numb, I used to punch the wall just to feel something but even that is not helping now. All I wanna do is talk to someone and pour my heart out but I do not know if I have the strength left to do that. Getting out of bed is starting to feel like a struggle and for the first time in a while I am afraid of myself, of what I might do if thing do not go my way. I know that this is not the end of the line but why doe it feel like it is? How can anyone recover from such a failure? It is gotten so bad that I would much rather prefer that I disappeared than having to tell my parent what is wrong. Depression is nothing new for my university and it would not be the first time that someone took a drastic step and now I know why they did what they did. The pressure and stress which come with a university a respected a mine, is just too much to handle. I am almost inclined to reveal my university is name just in case someone is able to figure out who I am and I can finally get the respite I desire so much. All around me I see happy face and I can only hope that one day I can leave all this behind me and be happy but in the meantime I guess I just have to struggle on and wait for the light at the end of the tunnel.

Trying to understand my depressed SO I am sorry if I am posting in the wrong sub. Advice greatly appreciated. Thanks

During my high school year I wa always a little klooster never went out that much never did anything bad .. When I left school I moved to Johannesburg and from there moved to my mom in Mpumalanga, South Africa, a day before my st birthday I got raped .. the most terrible feeling ever, I wa not wearing any revealing clothes, had jean a t-shirt and tekkies on, how do you explain this. I always believed that those girls, wearing the most revealing clothes are the one that ask for it, but do they really? I can not see how any one can ask for this, it is the worst thing that can ever happen to you. A few month thereafter I had to have an abortion due to the fact that I could not keep the baby .. I wa way too young, I never and still up until date, do not believe in this type thing, but now I think? Was it the right thing to do, will you ever be able to face the child the same way you will face a child born into a happy and wonderful marriage? I also suffer from depression, high blood pressure and all those wonderful things, I got married in December and due to me and my fiance having a big argument with my dad, he never walked me down the aisle on my big day and me and my husband had to pay for the whole wedding, I feel awful, but the thing my dad said and done can never be forgiven. My stepsister had a baby at the end of December and she is getting married now in April , guess who is doing and paying for her wedding .. I feel sick, sick of people always walking over me, always stuffing it in my face and my frustration get taken out on the wrong people, my husband is the one getting it? I battle to have healthy sex, due to the fact that every time I close my eyes, I see this person on top of me, forcing himself in, I feel guilty to have kids, how can I have more, if I killed one? How can I bring up a family if my own family is up to shit .. I often find myself wondering why? Why me, why am I the one cry myself to sleep, why do I have to keep myself in tone, to prevent a stroke, especially at my young age??

Reminder that it will get better. Everyday I get home from my part time job, I cry for at least half an hour before I get up to go inside and finish the rest of my day. Everyday I feel and believe that thing just keep getting heavier to deal with. That my life will not become healthier and I will not ever be happy. It is one issue after the next, or all at once and I keep wanting sometimes do push it off to the side. Everyday I also remind myself that it will get better. Sitting here alone, sobbing my eye out while texting this post, I do not believe it in these moments, but I am not giving myself any other choice exception. I will beat this and be happy. Depression and anxiety and all that jazz can suck the fun out of life in seconds. I want to remind you all that even when you really do not believe it, keep telling yourself you will be happy and healthy. I want all of you to, you deserve that at least.

Well I am new here so here go nothing. I have been diagnosed clinically depressed, along with obsessive compulsive disorder. I am year old. I have been divorced once and have since re - married. Well the major problem I am having is becoming a social recluse. I have a REALLY hard time letting thing go . In , I lost both my sister suicide and my father heart attack , and those event only added to the trauma I would been going through. I live in a small town, so when I went to the doctor about possible ADHD i wa moody, could not focus on work, could not complete task on time etc , they determined I wa bipolar and put me on Effexor and Wellbutrin. Well that just did absolutely nothing. In fact my anger with the world increased dramatically and I had rage episode that about destroyed my second marriage. I have had a lot of rage in the past. Recently I have not had any outbursts. I am currently taking Cymbalta and Celexa and that seems to be a good combination. But I still have a hard time going to work, and functioning throughout the day. I would rather stay at home, in my bedroom, away from people most of the time. That is what bother me. I am on antidepressants, but it doe not seem to help me get motivated to face the world. Does that come from within? Is there no magic pill that will all of a sudden make me feel confident? I guess that is good enough for now. I have a ton of mental history but do not want to flood anybody.

Hi, sorry if this turn into a lengthy post, but I could do with some advice, and I think this is probably the best place to ask. Firstly, I should point out, I am a year male. My problem is that I am concerned by the physical effect the depression is having on me. I have probably been suffering from depression for several years, but I only sought medical help last November after I had a breakdown. The doctor ha prescribed me with Fluoxetine, and I am taking mg per day. I originally started off on mg per day, but after I told the doctor what I will tell you now, about month ago, he upgraded my status to severe depression, hence the increase in dosage. I can appreciate that my mindset is slightly biased towards feeling negative, and expecting the worst, but nevertheless I cannot help but feel my symptom might be the result of an even more serious problem. The medication ha helped my mind even though I still have plenty of lows, they are not always a severe a they were month ago , yet my physical health is deteriorating to the point where that is the main factor preventing me from accomplishing day to day tasks. My symptom are a follows and they may be generalized, I will admit Constant fatigue, even after plenty of rest constant aching throughout the body generally feeling very weak, lacking energy and strength, e.g. carrying shopping home can leave my arm in agony loss of coordination, I have become very clumsy, always knocking glass over, or dropping thing for no reason occasional loss of balance, usually when getting up, or starting to walk from a stand still joint are feeling slightly stiff, they still move, but I can feel more resistance than normal and they get very tired very quick if wa to use them, or even just hold my arm straight out in front of me and for me, the worst symptom is an almost constant tremor in both hand and arms, which sometimes spread throughout the body. If I attempt slow, fine movement with my hands, the tremor becomes very clear and result in jerky movements. Also, I like to exercise, yet after all exercises, even low intensity ones, the trembling seems to intensify. I doubt it is anxiety, a I still shake when I am calm, relaxed and immobile. I know I cannot expect I diagnosis, but I would appreciate it if anyone can tell me if the severity of the physical effect I am experiencing, is quite common, even when the mental state is much more relaxed and beginning to recover? Thanks for any help

Hello, my name is Joe and I have been battling some form of depression, but I do not know what type or how severe it is. My mood swing from euphoria to deep depression to where I contemplate just cutting away from my life and vanish. I am not suicidal just feel at time isolation is the answer. I have one trigger I know of and it is usually when I am lacking in knowledge of a current situation I may be in. This make sense? Like tonight, I am out of town on business and working very late on some complex worksheets. I started getting depressed after the th hour of working and getting nowhere. This will then lead to insomnia and I will once again, for the second night in a row, be up all night working and mind wandering contemplating just getting in my car and driving to a remote town and re-invent myself. I have tried professional help, but to no avail I am just a bad if not worse. I figured since I am online most the day I would search for a forum that might lead me on a better path. After all shucking corn in Nebraska for room and board is not such a great option the next morning. Well thank you for this opportunity to at least get this off my mind for at least tonight.

I am I say this to myself all the time, SJW..I never thought I would be in this position..but I am..and so are you..I can relate to you on many levels. If I did not work for my father I am sure I would be unemployed..due to my concentration problems, ATTENDANCE problems, uneven mood and unpredictable production level..so I am very lucky. I can see what challenge you face. I often thought that I might like to go into some sort of counseling because of my life experience also. Do you live in a big enough city that you can apply at some mental health clinic or government aid departments? Sometimes the willingness to do that kind of work can get you in the door. It may be entry level, but you could work up if it were a job that satisfied your needs. What about like an activity director at a youth home, or a retirement village senior home, or a special need program? Here our recreation commission ha a special population program that coordinate trip and activity for the special population of the area. They go on ski trip and day trip and it look very fun! Of course it take a certain frame of mind to be able to work with the special population of the world. But I just mention it because you talked about counseling.. I just wanted to clarify that although I am very lucky to have an income, it really fuel my depression sometimes to think about how I am letting my dad down or causing him extra crap to deal with..so lucky and not so lucky.

When people with good intention say the wrong shit.. How do you deal with it? When someone who is just trying to help you say something that cut you really deeply, or when they are pushing you when you just need them to back off while. How do you personally deal with it? Recently I had an Uncle who I wa close with get involved trying to help with my depression and anxiety issues. He encouraged me to go see a therapist again for the first time in year and wa just there to talk and encourage. Then when he saw progress he started pushing more and more and I started getting really stressed. Then when I had a break down and started slipping back he took said some shit to me which really cut me deep. I stopped talking to him for a while after that. He said thing that confirmed what I thought people in my family were thinking abou me. Now the issue I am facing. I do not feel justified in being angry at him because he wa trying to help and he just got too excited at seeing progress that I had made many time before and then he got frustrated when it came to a halt. So now I just feel guilty at having the feeling and the anger turn inward and eats me up. But the anger and hurt do not go away from what he said either. It is been month and I just do not want to talk to or see him at all. He is reaching out again and I cannot find the word to explain the anger and hurt I feel, because I feel like I should not be angry or hurt. So it is just a big spiral of anger and shame. The worst part is I do not know of I can ever have the same relationship I had with him before. We were buddies. Even if I get over this I just do not know if the trust will ever be back. This make me sad. I did not really want him involved, but good intention make it hard to tell people their help is not wanted.

Dear reddit, happiness is not a choice for everyone I am sorry but I need to get this off my chest in a place where people will understand me. Dear people that think happiness is a choice, it is not. Me or my fellow sufferer do not choose to be miserable. In fact if it really wa that simple, I am sure of u would choose to be happy without even having to think. I feel sad because I have mental illness. If you do not know, that mean my brain is not normal. My brain ha deficiency and such that keep me from feeling happy, even when I should. I am so sick of reading reply to mine and other people is post about depression that try to oversimplify a serious mental illness that can cause suicide. I swear everyone on this website assumes we do nothing to try to help ourselves. I really cannot believe people are that misinformed that they really think that many people choose to be that miserable. You would not choose to be miserable if you had the choice, and so would we. But we do not get that choice. Then we have comment like Just put a life together that wont make you depressed . I think these piss me off the most. If it wa really that simple you think I would of done that by now? Also a lot of people do not mention how hard changing your life can be if you do not have money or resources. TLDR Stop oversimplifying a serious illness

Helping a girlfriend with depression possibly? Hello, I want to first off say this is a throwaway. I also looked for similar post regarding what I will ask, but i really want a tailored answer for my own sanity. Sorry for being selfish, this is just hard. I have been dating this girl for almost a year and I know she ha been slipping into an abyss of what I cannot diagnose, but seems like depression. I will start with a time table. We began dating after meeting on a popular dating app and we hit it off fast. Similar interest, goals, outlooks, expectations, and lifestyle. We became extremely close with in two month and then out of the blue she tell me it over. I did not feel it wa a justifiable way to end the relationship. I contacted her and we had long winded email correspondence with in which she had this quote to me I feel lost at work, lost in my personal life, and just lost with trying to find my happiness. You do make me happier. And idk what just snapped last week but I wa super depressed all week . I talked with her and we set small goal to rekindle and help her find her happiness. We got back together with in two week and that started a prolonged honeymoon period for which we traveled, went on ski trips, took our dog on hikes, and generally enjoyed ourselves. This continued until march or , when I noticed her slipping back in to her just overall never satisfied state. I got worried and tried to lightly push her to no avail. I then tried to make plan at least twice a month to help distract her and give her a solid thing to look forward to. Feeling good about helping people Does anyone else here ever feel better about themselves when you are able to offer a little help or guidance to someone off the street you do not know? As an example, sometime last month I wa having a pretty meh day, just.. Not feeling the worst ever, but not feeling very good either, when on my way home I happened to find an iPhone sitting on a grate outside the subway station. I picked it up and looked around for the owner, then after entering the station found a couple of young woman searching their bag and I asked if the phone wa theirs. It was, and they said thank you so much! And I felt really happy that I would been able to help them, like, I just kinda decided right then to forget about my problems, because, I would helped someone. Like, maybe those two would have never found their phone if I had not come along. I mean they probably would have, but, y know. I felt like I would been helpful in a real small but meaningful way and that felt good. I really like helping people, but I usually get upset when I try to help people I actually know personally, because, well, people do not always want help with more personal issues, or even with simple issue from people they know well, and trying to tell when to help or not is just really complicated. Like, I will just real nicely try to suggest a solution to a problem, or simply offering some consolation, and instead of, I dunno, actually trying it or telling me patiently why that is not a good idea, they just rail on me and tell me to shut up or whatever. And I just feel like, jeez, what would I do? I am trying to help here.. And I always get real upset about that and doubt myself over it, like, am I doing a bad thing by trying to be nice? I know that is not true, I get sometimes people want to figure thing out on their own, or I guess you do not like my attitude or blablabla, but, I dunno, you cannot maybe acknowledge that I am trying to do good? But in a situation where it is just strangers, trying to find their way, cross the street, lost a thing or whatever, it is easy to tell when they need help, because everything is a lot more straightforward, if that make sense. If someone need help, it is usually pretty obvious and they are almost always pretty receptive to help, and, provided you just look like a normal person, they do not judge. No bias or baggage over past interaction or whatever, they are just happy to have help. So yeah I guess this is a little longer than it need to be, but, yeah. Helping random people feel good and distracts from my depression a little. Is what I wa saying. Anyone else feel this way?

Every Day is Exactly the Same. I am Lonely, Worthless, and Done With Life Every day, I wake up, go to work, come home, and go to sleep. That is basically it. That is my life. Sure, I have a few friend that I see on the weekends, but it only help so much. My ex girlfriend broke up with me and moved out of our apartment month ago now. The almost three year we were together were the only time in my life where my depression wa pretty much nonexistent. When she came home that day and told me she wa done, I wa floored. I had no idea that she felt the way she did, and she would not even discus the matter with me. I have tried meeting other people since then, and I have gone on exactly three date with one person. That is it. I am basically invisible to women, and no amount of effort will ever change that. I just have to accept the reality that I hold absolutely no value in a romantic context. Why? I do not know. Maybe it is because my generation is only interested in people who are aesthetically in the top tier, or make the most money. Maybe it is because my generation is eschewing committed relationship in favor of having fuck buddy left and right, whoring themselves out to whoever will get their rock off, both men and woman are at fault for this. I do not think I am a particularly unattractive guy, and I make a pretty damn good amount of money for my age, but since I am not in that top of men, I am just always going to be passed over and there is absolutely nothing I can do about it. It is almost like there something inherent to my existence that prevents me from having any intimacy. No matter how much money I make or how much I improve myself, that intrinsic quality of my being will always hold me back. I did not ask for this, but it is the way thing are, so I have pretty much given up completely. I do not have any plan of offing myself or anything like that. But every day, it get harder and harder to convince myself that I actually have anything worth living for. The one thought I keep coming back to is how scared my cat would be if I gave her to a shelter or how she would get by if I were gone. I love my cat, and she doe not deserve to be put in a situation like that. I feel like she is the only thing keeping me marginally together. The thought of causing her any distress break my heart, and one of the big thing on my mind all the time is simply making sure she is happy and feel safe. I feel worthless and frustrated. I wish I understood how to achieve what I want in life and be happy, but I guess that is just not in the cards. I cannot wait until the day I die, I will finally get some goddamn peace and quiet. I am so tired of feeling broken. I am so tired of constantly being reminded that there is something wrong with me, like I am some sort of bastard aberration of what human are supposed to be. I have struggled with this for year now. I do not know how much more I can take.

Painfully lonely and spiraling into the worst depression I have ever been in I recently moved to a new city for a job after college. I have a few friend at work, but they are a group of guy that I do not have a lot in common with and we do not really talk outside of the occasional work conversation. They are nice and I am happy to be friend with them, but it is hard for me to really get to know them because they do guy stuff on the weekend like sitting around drinking and playing FIFA that I am totally not interested in they do not bother inviting me to. Other than that, I have a few online friend that I am growing increasingly dependent on for social interaction which is really unhealthy. I notice myself getting more paranoid with them about not responding, and I bug them way too much to the point where I know I would definitely be annoyed if I wa them. Also they are not very supportive probably the opposite but it is not their fault -- they are just causal online friend that should not have to cater to my current host of mental problems. I am totally alone. My family and college friend live hour away. I have pretty bad social anxiety and I am terrified of every new social interaction I have. I work hour and come home to my empty apartment and watch netflix to escape my own life, every day. I sometimes hear from my college friend about all of the fun they are still having together and it honestly brings me to tear that I have such a pathetic lonely life now. I have never been able to have a normal social life -- it take me forever to make close friends, and then even at my best I only have a handful of good friend at a time. I do not enjoy going out every weekend or the other obvious way of making friends, and that would not work now anyway since I would NEVER go alone and I do not have a single person that I could ask to go with me. When I wa a freshman in college I had this same problem -- absolutely zero friend and living in a totally different city. It wa the worst depression I have ever been through. I had dozen and dozen of online friend at the time now we have all lost touch and moved on from the RPG we were playing that helped ease the loneliness, and I eventually joined a student club and finally made friend after like a year of going. There is not really anything I can join like that in a non-college town.. I have been applying for a few volunteering things, they have not started but I am doubtful that it will be a good way to meet people. I honestly just need ONE person to talk to. Anyone. I do not know what is wrong with me, I am not a complete weirdo or anything and I know I can have meaningful friendship just of them have been online, and now I cannot even seem to make any fucking online friend either , but I live the loneliest life of anyone I have ever known or heard of. I have never been serious about suicide, but recently that is changed and it is becoming something I could actually picture myself doing. I am a long way from that but at this point I do not see anything getting better and I practically cry myself to sleep some day and have to hide emotional breakdown at work after eating lunch alone. Does anyone have any advice for meeting new people in a non-college town? Anyone else having the same problem? I am so lost and sad and pathetic

I have realized that I made a big mistake by starting this blog. It serf no purpose to put feeling out for public view, so I have deleted the entry from the last six months. I wa going to explain some things, but thought better of it. I think a small part of my old self ha awakened again. I am a bit ashamed of all the whining I have done here. I am embarrassed that I have sought out people in my life for emotional support when I should have dealt with thing privately, on my own. When I lost my mind to grief, I forgot everything that I knew. As the old adage go you come into this world alone, you live alone, you die alone. You solve your problem alone, need to be added. The intense pain of grief can warp your mind, impair your judgment and make you do foolish thing that you will later regret. I am sorry if I have upset anyone, but my intention wa simply an attempt at self-help, not to change the world. I wa simply searching for a way to try to deal with and escape from this pain. I have always appreciated the supportive comment left by people and I thought I had expressed that before. I never thought anyone had an expectation that I would contact them or would even really want me to contact them. I am after all, a stranger to those who have read my words. I wa getting to the point where I wa starting to consider emailing some of the people who have posted comments, just to thank them, but now I think that it is better that I do not. This is the old, public version of me writing to day. I have pushed most of the real, troubled me back down into a box for a little while. I have resolved only to let her out when I am alone. In this blog, I did dwell on many of the same thing again and again, but I wa surprised that I could actually find some release by repeatedly talking about the same thing. I think this will be my last entry, so goodbye and good luck.

I am new and my message doe not seem to fit anywhere else. So I used to write suicide note and when I could read them without cry then I would deem myself ready. Or I would think that if I could starve myself for a week then I would be ready. This one I could not do finally it all got too much. In my head, my parent were so disappointed in me that they would be better off without me and to my sister I wa too annoying that they would not miss me. Up until now I had jus cut myself discreetly. So I took paracetamol not knowing then that they cannot actually kill you and jus sat around waiting - half excited half scared. Nothing happened for age and I started to get more scared - what would my parent think? Would they cope? Would they blame themselves? So I threw up and called an ambulance myself. I will never get over how hurt they were by what I had done and so will never do that again. But I still think bout it. When ever thing get too hard. I think how can I make it look like an accident a I know they could handle that much better than suicide. I have been on antidepressant for month now. For the rd time. I cannot get motivated to study, go to class, go out, anything. I do not care. I do not see the point in living a miserable life and what if there is no point? what if our world are all the creation of our mind and once our mind are dead, so is our world so there is no one left hurting once were gone? What is the point to a miserable life when it could all be ended now? I do not think suicide is the right way to go - I believe only god, whatever you conceive him to be if anything should have the only power over life and death, but why doe he take some people and not others? More specifically, me? I pray that he will take me next - give me the cancer meant for someone who love life - but a yet ha been to no avail. But if all we are to do is to be alive then die, why can I not decide to take my death into my own hands, like so many people do what they want with their lives? Of course, there is always the factor of limbo - do people who commit suicide really end up in limbo? I suppose what scare me even more is that - going through the pain and anguish of suicide just to end up in limbo - with just your mind, thinking away for ever.. are my feeling wrong? Is it a chemical reaction in my brain? Or do I just not belong in this life? So confused! And just do not see the point in being here - anyone have the answer I am looking for? Life is pointless.

I lost my job, i am in the worst place i have ever been, and nothing make sense or feel fair. I have worked at the same place for nearly three years. It is an entry level retail job, but i have not ever had anything else, so it wa really the only thing that made me feel validated. Recently, for the fifth time i got passed up for a promotion, but this time marked the end. The girl who got promoted over me is one of my best friend in the world. She is absolutely amazing, and i am so happy for her, but it wa the hardest to accept. She started about a year ago, and i helped train her and build her up. She wa my partner in everything, and i feel like i would be there for the thing she could not do, and she would be there for the thing i could not do. Seeing her success is the most proud i have ever been, but it is made me the most miserable. I basically found out that after busting my as for over two years, my partner wa going to be my boss. I learned pretty fast how much care and respect she hold for me, and i do not think anything will change that. I hope not. This job wa beating me down. I trained a lot of our best staff, and i had a lot of associate come to me before management, feeling like i wa more of a leader to them than our actual leadership was. We lost a lot of people due to burnout and frustration with management, but i know that i always cared about the people i got to train and help, and took a lot of pride in their success. Even after getting underpaid, undervalued, and shafted at every turn, i always stayed because i cared about the people i worked with and i would not give up on them. One would think that leaving a shit situation would make me happy, but it just doe not. Despite my year retail and leadership experience, it is been hard to find another job. Most people offer me le money than i made before not much and basically completely ignore any qualification i actually have. I am in school. I finish community college this year and will move to a four year school assuming i can a my performance is not amazing. I I want to pursue grad school to gain qualification a an industrial org psychologist, but everything seems so far away. I feel like with being a Psych major i am just going to end up equally a useless with a four year degree, and even if grad school doe work out, that is overall another four year from now. I have to pay bills, and i hate feeling so useless. I am not going to starve and die or anything. My family ha money, and ha offered to help me pay bill if i cannot find a job, but that just make thing worse in a way. I moved away from home because i wanted to be my own person. It ha been three year and i have not had to ask for help from anybody. I hate the thought that i will have to rely on these people who have given me everything to give me more. It is not their fault that i am a fuck up. A man said to the universe Sir, I exist! However, replied the universe, The fact ha not created in me A sense of obligation. - Stephen Crane I know that life is not fair. I know nobody owes me anything, but i hate that it seems like i always end up last. My friend get to be happy, my other friend practically run the store now but not enough to help, because the SM make all the decision and she is shitty , but i have the least and i get the least. My staff and coworkers get people to hang out with. Everyone get to go home to someone that love them when they fail and get comfort from that. I do not get that. I am alone, and i have always been. The joy i get is from making other people happy because i cannot make myself happy. I want to make these people never have to feel how i do. It is just so fucking unfair that thing just seem to work out better for everyone else. I do not know what to do, i do not know where to go, and i do not know how to be happy. This is the worst it ha been. Usually i go home for a bit to take my mind off things, or can occupy my time with video game or something to take my mind off things. Nothing is fun right now. Can people stop telling me that hiking and exercise is the magical cure? Where do I find the energy to go for a hike when being awake for three hour make my body physically ache? I get it, it is helpful for a lot of people but telling me to go get my yoga pant on and be at one with nature will not cure a thing and by repeating that useless mantra you are making me worse. Rant over, I am going back to bed. Edit a few people telling me if I exercise I will lose weight and feel better about myself. I only need to try it apparently. On the advice of my doctor, I have tried it, even walking. I do walk, every day, no matter how I feel. I also do not need to lose weight and being overweight is not the reason I am depressed because I am not overweight . Just saying to stop preaching the exercise mantra a if it is the only thing that could possibly fix what is a very real mental illness that ha nothing to do with how often I move, flex or jump. My point is that it is not working.

Hi folks, I have only discovered this topic after making several previous post I am from a traditional Asian culture, but now half-westernized on migration to Australia since age . I have had a long history that stem right to my parent history before I wa born. To cut it very short, my father ha schizoid schizotypal socially withdrawn personality traits, and my mother ha dependent traits, so they basically had a loveless marriage common in my culture . There is a long history of parental quarrelling and physical abuse on my mother before and after I wa born, some of which I heard a a child to early teens. I wa seldom exposed socially growing up, and I had few school friends. I wa also born a quiet person, but this and lack of socializing made me a withdrawn kid. When I wa about , I believe I experienced one psychotic episode I isaw caped grim reaper at that time , since which I have no further experiences. I experienced a few bout of depression during secondary school, for which I did not seek help because of my shyness and parental cultural stigma that wouldepression doe not exist thankfully my family ha ditched that attitude now . During that time, I had many suicidal thought and attempted suicide maybe time but did not tell anyone about it. A very terrible incident also happened towards the end of high school - one night, I physically assaulted my father while he wa quarrelling with mom, and he wa hospitalized. I got charged with assault, but no conviction wa recorded after I did psychotherapy for anger control - that wa also the only therapeutic contact with psychological psychiatric service I had until very recently. That incident, although I felt numb through that time, ha been scarred into my memory - I can still recall the events, and my conscience is still wrecked over it, though I continue to fight it and let it go. At school, I wa a top-end academic achiever in science and math. I wa named dux of the school on graduation. Upon entering university, my depression became worse mainly because of increased social isolation. I wa still shy and withdrawn, I lost contact with my high school friend they also saw me a weird , but I wa also a bit narcissistic towards them at some time - I think it wa an unconscious aggressive reaction towards them , and failed to make any lasting friendship with university peers. One year into university, I started studying Medicine, which I am still doing at the moment. However I felt that course had over time did not improve me, though I did make few friends. I still felt unable to socialize with peers, even though I wa in constant contact with them through many lecture and tutorials. Even though I wa an average performer, I felt I struggled heavily through the year with study. Late last year, my depression hit a new low - my parent had another quarrel, and I wa studying psychiatry which forced me to realize the extensiveness of my past and current problems. It wa another awful time - I lost a lot of self-confidence esteem, became more withdrawn. I ended up failing my first practical exam but still passed given my past satisfactory academic record - the faculty put it down to lack of practice, but the truth is because of what I experienced leading up to the exam. In this year however my depressive bout became much worse - my few friend had deferred, and I wa left with no friends, despite still knowing the others by name . My experience during this year wa largely negative - I felt harassed by teaching doctors, peers, being looked at a a weirdo and excluded from conversation and their social outing whether this wa a valid view, I am finding out now by resocializing with them - my main aim at the moment . Over the last month I had about more depressive episodes, and attempted suicide times, again nobody knew about them. It became a frantic situation - I approached the faculty dean for help, but he only recommended me a psychiatrist, who he wa supposed to contact before I contacted him. However that psychiatrist wa not notified, and I felt very angry about it and thought that nobody wa out there to help me. In retrospect, my view wa unrealistic - help only exists on a professional level, something I knew long before but did not acknowledge at that time, making me upset. My depression faded away a few day later. A few night ago, I had a short dispute with mom, got upset and this eventually led to me joining this forum after a quick search on the net. Why am I writing this intro? Several reasons. I want to tell my story to others, and feel this is a stepping stone to encourage myself. I also want others not yet aware that depression can affect ANYONE, even the best of us, even those involved in the medical profession up to of junior doctor suffer from depression, and up to have attempted committed suicide . I want to improve my own situation - most of all, learning to deal with feeling of sadness and negatively that ha crippled me mentally in the past, and my lack of sociability which doe not help my situation. I know deep inside I am capable of pulling through, of being able to live a normal healthy life because I am aware of my problem and have the power to deal with them. Finally, although I am still a student, I believe my position is privileged and that I should use what knowledge I have learnt to help others a best a I can, something I will be bound to by Hippocratic Oath on finishing school. I am grateful that such a forum exists for others and me to express our thoughts, experience and feelings, and that there are people out there who devote themselves for such causes. Thank you all.

I have just now realized now, after year of experiencing it, that what I have suffered from is depression. Soon after that, I spoke to my dad about it, and learned he would been on AD is for over year now, and he said he probably could have used them from the time he wa about year old on. He also said my paternal grandmother is side of the family wa all just like u my dad and I are almost carbon copy of each other, except he is always seemed much more perfect to me than I am. He also said my oldest half brother is also on AD is. I also talked to my oldest daughter who is year-old , and she said she is been on AD is a few time too. I can say also that I learned many year after his death that my maternal grandfather experienced severe depression before I wa born. He had shock therapy multiple time it seems..but I do not know if his problem were entirely from the extreme horror he experienced in WWII, or a combination of that plus other problems. When I knew him he wa always a sweet loving, rather quiet, man and my favorite person in the world other than my dad. My dad said he never associated my problem with depression of course, neither did I , but now it all clicks. I wish I would known all this when I wa younger, that depression had not had the stigma it had back in the s s, and that I could have gotten treatment back then. Of course, if I had, I would not have the same life I have now, so I guess I cannot complain about that and honestly would not change a thing..I would not risk losing my kid or what I have accomplished, no matter how crooked and difficult the path a been . But I will definitely watch my young kid now for sign of depression especially my year-old daughter, since she seems to have a similar personality to my dad and I . If I see it, they will get the treatment they need immediately! So in that sense I think this is a blessing..knowledge is power.

I posted here sometime in December I think. I wa having ton of digestive problems, well it is been about month now and I am still having them, but now I also feel extremely fatigued all the time too, I have had test after test and seen doctor after doctor, everything come back negative. I wa actually put on Zoloft for about a month but taken off of it to try other thing b c that wa not doing the trick either. I am back to thinking that it is all in my head, I am now on b shot but those are not doing anything either. I feel like a zombie, I have zero energy and zero motivation to do anything. Even the simplest task like styling my hair seems like a huge chore that I just want to put off. All I want to do is sleep all day. One thing I have noticed is that man do I ever waste time, I mean I literally do nothing but waste time most of the day. I only have about two hour of class per day and no job so I have ton of free time to waste away. I analyzed what I did in the past hour and it basically went like this The entire time I wa talking to myself non-stop, analyzing things, analyzing my situation, thinking of motivational quote etc.. I tend to do that all day. For about minute I stood around leaning against a wall, the next minute i leaned against the television, then I went and lied down for a while all while still thinking and analyzing thing in my head, then I came on the computer to just look at random, pointless things. And that is pretty much how most of my time is spent, I might spend an hour or so just standing around or sitting doing nothing but thinking or daydreaming, that cannot possibly be healthy and I obviously have way too much free time, I am just not sure if this is what is in turn causing all my fatigue and sickness. Have I become so addicted to this lifestyle that my mind will purposely make me feel sick so I have an excuse to live like this?

I began to openly discus my depression to my friends. It wa very painful to discus but I think it is a step in the right direction. Up to now, I have never discussed my depression with anyone besides my husband and my therapist. I have slight PTSD from when I wa kid and a teacher had been concerned for me by some disturbing behavior. I felt even more misunderstood and felt so much anguish that I became really good at disguising my depression. I hid it under a fake, likable, version of myself because I wanted to fit in and feel like I belong. Currently, my closest friend are my coworkers but they the most judgmental people I have known. We became close by commiserating together at work. Fast forward a few years, I am finally starting to feel better after seeking help for my depression. I have been seeing a therapist for over a year, began taking antidepressant two month ago, and have been taking cognitive behavioral therapy sessions. As I begin to feel better, I also feel more miserable hanging out with my friends. I decided to be more open with the people around me about my depression. I revealed it today for the first time with one of my closest friends. It wa incredibly scary for me.. I have not felt this vulnerable in a long time. My friend typically see me a a guarded person with a hard exterior, but I felt tear welling in my eyes. He wa very surprised to hear, but I am not the first person he know with depression so it wa reassuring to know he did not think I wa some sort of freak. He also commended me for taking step in getting better and encouraged me to continue talking about it. It wa a positive experience overall. I then decided to tell another friend later in the day because I wa feeling good after the discussion I had earlier. It went a little differently though.. His first question was, what do you have to be depressed about?! which instantly flooded my mind with negative feeling of remorse. I tried my best to keep calm and answer his question honestly. I explained that it is not any thing or anyone that is making me feel depressed. It is a mental condition I have which cause me to be in a persistent state of sadness and worthlessness. He asked me if I understand where Eric is coming from his bipolar nephew that he sometimes mention , and I said yes. He then seemed to become more curious and asked me many question about what it is like. In the end, I feel like I educated him on depression and hopefully helped debunk his belief that depression is just a feeling that people should be able to snap out of. I honestly do not think I could have these conversation if I wa in the state I wa even a month ago. Even today, I felt myself slipping into the familiar downward spiral. I do not know what kept me composed today, but I am so proud of myself for making it through the conversation without snapping or becoming defensive. Perhaps if I had these conversation in reverse order, it could have been a completely different experience. I hope this inspires others to talk about it, seek help and be open to receiving it. It wa quite uncomfortable but I am happy to create an opening for other people to understand what we are going through.

Has your family always ignored your problem? I think the hardest part of being depressed since I wa a kid is how absolutely ignored I wa am by my family. My parent split up when I wa and my father died when I wa . My family completely sweeped it under the rug like I wa supposed to be completely ok with it and it ha never been a topic of discussion at home. I walked around sad, slumbered over, quiet, avoided eye contact and stared into the distance for year and year and no one ever assumed proper to ask if there is something wrong with me. The only time they sent a psychologist my way wa when they had to determine who I should live with after divorce. My mother to this day seems absolutely oblivious to my suffering. I do not ever feel like telling them for they will propably assume I am ungrateful and spoilt. I have had everything! They sent me to school, fed me, put clothes on my back. What else could I possibly need? I do not want to burden or blame anyone for what ha happened but just I feel so abandoned.

Going back to the title, I think it is entirely likely I am not meant to survive on this earth. In a universe that is so fucking vast, it make too much sense for there to be the possibility that some human just are not meant to live like everyone else. Maybe I am destined to kill myself. I would rather not, I would rather something else kill me so I do not have to deal with it.

I appreciate you. Life is a strange place. Full of misfortune, pain and suffering. For whomever is reading this. You do not deserve the pain and depression that you may have. I do not know what you have experienced in you are life. I want to say I am sorry for everything bad that is happened to you. Everyone deserves to be loved and to be happy. For those who do not have anyone to compliment you, let me be their friend. You are the most beautiful being I have ever seen. You are intelligent, strong, and wonderful. I am am so proud of you. You can do whatever you want. If you want be successful then I will be here to say I believe in you!. I am you are biggest fan and I will always be rooting for you. When I see you, I see a hero. You survived so many year of life. Nothing ha fully stopped you from living your life. You have survived this long. If you think life would be better with you being gone, then you are sadly mistaken. Screw those people who try to bring you down. To spite them you should live your life to the fullest. Take a moment and try to enjoy this. Feel the sun is light on your beautiful face. Take a nap on the earth soft grass. Smell the flower and enjoy your favorite food. It is important to take a break and just take thing slow for a moment. Life is constantly going to try to bring you down. When you fall I wanna lend you my hand to lift you back up, a l believe you would do the same for me. We are all brother amd sister here. When life push we need to stand together and push back. I appreciate you and all that you stand for. When you are feeling down, I want you to stop and try to appreciate others. Appreciate those who walk the same path with you. Thank you for listening to me and thank you for being you. I appreciate you and I am sure others do too. I hope you can find it in you to appreciate and help others. Have a lovely day.

What is the point of coming up if you are gonna go down? I moved to a new city with the love of my life after year of loving him. I wa ready to propose, I looked at rings, I called jewelers. I debated getting a ring of meteorite, you know? He is super nerdy, super cute. Science geek and all. I would like to think every guy buying ring think about the meteorite ring haha. Then he tell me that he feel like a she. I loved her no matter what. I told her I still loved her and that she is going to be one of the most beautiful girl ever. I still planned to propose. I loved her more that she is her true self. Then my heart get broken. She tell me that she cannot see a future with me together. She tell me that she is only interested in women. There wa not much for me to do but respect her true feelings. I could not force her to love me. For a few week I lost my best-friend and my future. We still lived together, music helped, weed helped. I made friends. I tried to be happy, and for a little I think I really wa okay. But it wa so stormy, one tip of the scale and I wa back to being broken. Then I find out that she is seeing other guys. My heart wa gone, the only feeling is that feeling when your heart drop to your stomach. It is a little harder to swallow, did life get harder? Did she make it easier? I do not know. I wa not good enough for her. She say otherwise. I know she mean the best for me with her heart but man, did it hurt the same. I ask her to give me time, a a roommate, a a past lover, give me time to heal before you see someone. Please, just give me some time to heal. But she could not wait. I do not blame her, she is discovering herself. She is beautiful. I never had a chance. There are better men for her. I am broken, the piece stomped on. I try. I go to work. I exercise. I eat healthy. I tell myself improve for yourself and no one else . It is a lie. Life seems to drag on, I try to smile, I miss my best friend. I try to act like everything is alright to her. She cannot be seeing me like this, it hurt her too. I meet a guy. He is cute, a little simple, but cute. We start to hang out, workout together even. He take me to some of the most beautiful places, I try to swallow my doubt and bring my heart back. Somedays, I could swallow just fine around him. When I wa sure I wa ready, I told him. It wa too late. I took too long. I wa just dead. I made plans, wrote good bye letters, planned that my little sibling would get what money I had left. I know it is selfish, I know it can get better. I even tried to find a program that sends email at a certain time so everyone could get a good night sleep before they received my letter. I could not do it. I stood on the edge of a bridge, the edge of a cliff, wore my favorite clothes. Listened to my favorite songs. Every time I could not do it. You never think of it a someone being brave. But I wa scared, I could not imagine how anyone took that step off, pulled the trigger, kicked the chair. They had to be brave. And now, I am back. I am ready to kick the chair, I am ready to pull the trigger, I am ready to jump.

What a great topic!! The news always make me cry - and I end up turning it off shortly after I start watching it - why do I punish myself? My parent know that I have learned to not watch the news because of the negative effect it ha on me, so if something really important is going on, they let me know. My Aunt suffers from chronic depression and delusion, and I have had numerous conversation with her on how to handle the depression because she is tried so many different things, even going to Mexico to see a Shaman. Her top suggestion and I really go by them a much a I possibly can are Get proper sleep - this is probably the most paramount point get proper nutrition and do not watch the news. The one thing that I absolutely cannot tolerate is sad news about animal - that really sends me. When I am flipping thru channel and happen upon Animal Planet and the Animal Police are busting people because of their cruelty - I have to turn it immediately. I think I am delusional too in that I choose not to watch the news, animal stories, anything really unpleasant - I guess I try to live in my little world without negativity or sadness. I know that it is not very mature or adult, but this is my coping mechanism. I do find that when I hear or see anything sad or awful that my negativity really get into gear, and then I am completely negative for awhile. Driving is also incredibly difficult because I commute into Washington D.C. from the suburb and traffic is awful. I become so negative about the other driver around me that I end up hating myself over my thought about them! They, of course, drive too slow and are idiots. I need to find a job close to home! I too have sometimes felt that the human race need to think about not populating the world anymore. I would not want to raise a small child in this environment any more! I am glad my son is in college and he is the only one that I could have. But then again, I cannot wait until my sister or brother ha kid so that I can be with them and spoil them rotten. Crazy is not it? I have taken others suggestion in this thread and have tried to make myself think positively the last days. It is difficult but possible! I notice that my mood ha brightened somewhat too. Thanks to you all for this thread, a I think it really can help!

I am in a state of emptiness. Recently, I wa in a relationship with someone who did not love me, but I loved them intensely. I had hoped eventually she would turn around, but for that time, I found deep meaning in her. Now it is over, and she doe not seem to care. Meanwhile, I am in hell. It is like the past four year of my life were just a dream. I feel humiliated, used and defeated. I feel like I have nothing. I lost my job, stopped going to school, and wa forced to move back in with my parents. I feel like a total failure and completely worthless. I feel like I am being punished by God, and there is no way out. Even in my dream I cannot escape the pain. I cannot see the good in anything anymore. Everywhere, I see pain and suffering, with no hope. Even when I meet incredible people who am in awe of, I feel almost envious, knowing that I am a worthless, useless nothing in the presence of angels. I still have some friends, but have grown distant from them. Seeing their success, no matter how minute, just reminds me of my worthlessness. I have nothing to offer the world. I am without purpose. Even when I have enough thing to distract me, my ex is still in my dream or nightmare every night. Before I met her, I got my life on track, wa kicking as in school, and headed for something. I know I cannot blame her, but I just feel so stupid for getting caught up in her drama for no reason. What a waste. I do not know. I have been reflecting on my life a lot. I am and have nothing to show for it. I feel like I have to make drastic changes. Liquor and drug are not doing me any good. I do not know what the hell I want anymore. I am so lost, sometimes I do not even know if I am really alive. I feel like right now, I have to settle for mediocrity and hope for simple low - stress job that pay the bills, but I do not have any source of joy or anything really to look forward too. I have pinpointed that the major source for depression and life problem a been my self-hatred. It manifest itself in many forms, including obsessive feeling of inadequacy and incompetence, paranoia, being overly - sensitive to criticism, feeling worthless, hopeless, and giving up too easy because of those feelings. Where did all this self - hatred come from? I do not want to blame my parent at my age, but I know that how they treated me when I wa younger affected me and it still lingers in my psyche. They always employed the shame approach to parenting. Anytime something happened, my father would curse at me, and lecture me on how worthless I was. He would glare at me, and I just had to sit there and listen. Sometimes I would start crying, and then he would yell at me for crying, and say shit like look at you, you are not even ashamed. Shame wa apparently a virtue. My mother once told me when I wa that she wanted to have a third child, but because I wa such a disappointment, she decided against it. They hit me frequently, with a bamboo stick. I remember they would constantly compare me to their friend is children, praising them and ask me why I could not be more like them. So all this happened, but I cannot change the past. I do not want to dwell and blame my parent for their mistakes, no one is a perfect parent. I just want to get over these feeling of self - hatred and get my life in order. I have identified the source of my depression, but have not been able to change all those feeling and thought-processes that have been ingrained in me since early childhood. Does anyone have any advice on how to overcome these feelings, and gain a sense of confidence and direction back?

I am year old single black mother and I have been struggling with depression ever since I wa a small girl. Throughout the course of my life I have had a lot of share of ups and down parent divorced in , father wa on drugs, domestic abuse, severe teasing, idiotic boyfriend and the list go on. If there were problem in the home, you dealt with it at home and kept your mouth shut tight. There is no such thing a a black woman being depressed. Black woman MUST keep this aura of being strong, independent, swallow your tears, raise your children, take the blow that life throw at you and keep moving with the beat. If you did not keep moving with the beat, then you will fall through the crack everyone see it and you will be considered a weak and no one will want to deal with you. Everyone around you will let you have it and you will be labeled a an outcast among your fellow black sister and brothers. I have had a few suicide attempt and my family thought that I wa just trying to get sheer childish attention a to say, I am a big baby, pay attention to me. They took it a a joke and it broke my spirit down to a trillion pieces. I constantly worried what my friends, co-workers, class mates, and lover would see me a a walking disaster waiting to happen. At the time, I did a good job of covering it up for a long time. It painfully and slowly came out. I wa afraid that if I told some one that I wa severely depressed, I would not get the love, support, and care that I needed family labeled me a CRAZY . So if you have any comment please feel free to let me know what you think about black woman and depression.

Need to talk and I have nobody. Hey all. Just need to talk, really struggling right now and trying to dig out of it. Not really sure what else to do. Pattern of behaviour Wake up in the morning with immediate feeling of depression and loneliness. Acute feeling of being alone in bed, uncomfortable. Become compelled to flip through Bumble, Tinder because I feel a need to try and immediately correct the problem. I never and I mean never match. Have to fight urge to immediately abuse addiction like porn and weed. Sometimes do, sometimes do not. Prepare for work, fight off feeling of sadness about ex-girlfriend and situation it put me in. Fight the urge to blame her for the failure of the relationship even though I logically know I am wrong or that is not fair. She just left to pursue school and had to move on, she did not do anything to me. Fight feeling of rejection and feeling of inadequacy in my value to others even though there is no reason to feel that here. Walk to work, continue to fight with anger issue re relationship and validation. Sometimes frustration stem from lack of work success but more often than not it is physical appearance issue and relationship issues. I get caught in a loop being mad at her and being mad at myself and my capacity to deal with being alone. Auto-pilot at work. Able to do job easily, so lack of focus is a non-issue. I spend too much time on Facebook and other social medium looking for outlet to expand my social network and friends. Find it very difficult to do so without appearing over-anxious or creepy and new opportunity rarely prevent themselves. Sometimes Imarket business and contact client potential clients. Sometimes a boost come from having success here, but often the lack thereof is equally esteem damaging. Go home, usually bus. Already tired. Immediately engage addictions, usually beer and weed. Start watching TV or playing game and rarely stop until bed time. I will leave easy task like cleaning dishes, etc for weeks. Continual evasion of solving problems, instead opting to rely on substance to either forget or balance my feeling of sadness. Occasionally I have friend over, but many of them use substance a well or are in similar life situation so finding solace in these encounter is limited. Furthermore, they are my friend of many year and represent a kind of social stagnation. At night I am usually in bed by , not because I am out of thing to do, but because I am either drunk or bored. On weekend I am lucky if I do anything outside of what I do immediately after work. I rarely feel compelled to do anything. If I get invited to a bar, I end up going and feeling alienated from everyone and out-of-place . Most of the time, I just feel too tired to join my friends, but I also feel a lack of motivation because I am sure it will just be the same crowd and it appears their life keep moving while mine doe not. I am behind on adulthood. I have only recently acquired a driver is license, I just renewed my glass prescription and only just started living on my own. I have to get my teeth taken care of and they are a source of stress and physical pain still have wisdom teeth at . I have the habit of a teenager. I smoke copious amount of weed, I drink daily and I do not pursue my interest or goals. I know the right course of action most of the time, but I actively ignore it because the amount required to get healthy is just too much. I have spent a great majority of my life single and most of my relationship aside from a few gem have been tumultuous, emotional rollercoasters. More often than not, Despite all these thing I feel undervalued in my society. I think of myself a smart, funny and confident in my skills, but I feel that the rest of the world doe not care and doe not see those a appealing. I feel like without look and an academic education, you can only accomplish so much and that people is standard are so high that competition for a good role in society is unlikely. I feel unable to compete when the above issue prevent me from succeeding. Motivation to do anything is lowered by the lack of acceptance in general, the feeling that I should be acceptable the way I am but am not, and my inability to seem to control that situation. It doe not help that on the face of it, most people will tell me that I seem like a catch , an incredibly high-value person with lot to offer except that none of that seems to translate to my life, emotional attachment or stability. I am just lost.

Failure to trust nothose on my side . possible trigger Warning I find myself incapable of trusting my spouse. I have been with my SO for nearly years, married this year, we have children. Before I hit my mid-teens I would been through nearly a decade of sexual abuse within the already dysfunctional household I grew up one, with an alcoholic father and a narcissistic mother. I met my now spouse when I wa . He had been in a two year relationship with a girl a few year his senior, which left him broken after her infidelity. And I well I lived day to day, carrying what I could. I will never forgot how I coldly and factually told him with a mere two sentence what I had to endure, telling him that if he did chose me, he would be settling for a lifetime shared with a woman with severe ups and down due to her limited mental strength. He convinced me to go for it and I wept in his arms. That wa probably the first time in my life someone did not look the other way and I allowed myself to be vulnerable, instead of distant and cold. I opened myself up to him. Few year later my home situation imploded. I ran. His mother took me under her wing, I think she wa the first parental figure I could lean on in my life. His father loathed me a the girl from the slums, threatening me in private to never marry his son. Reminding me of my lowly descent when he could. He would never come to accept me fully but at least fully respect me in public, which to me is commendable enough. Afterwards I started living with my now SO, still during our teen in a studio. The idea wa triggered and pushed for by me a a solution after a bout of infidelity on his side after he moved to study in a city a couple hour away. He partook in intimate relation with a girl he knew from another country over webcam due to loneliness and held the act in the same regard a watching porn whereas I did not. We tried to work thing out. As we did my view of him started to crumble, but wa rebuilt after living together surprisingly worked remarkably well. We grew more towards each other and were best friend on top of lovers. In between this life changing chapter and where I am now, he ha had a few strike I simply can not forget. While I wa once open to share my ups and down and sadness with him, now I would rather not. Because where I once trusted him to hold me, I now trust him to ridicule me and tell me to man the fuck up. And the stubborn as I am, I do, but this come with resentment. But to explain the strike - One is where I wa cry after having particularly bad and involuntary memories. Annoyed by my state and stressed by upcoming final he asked me When is this going to end? You are always spinning the same old tales, you are driving yourself insane. - Another wa when he screamed out while we had visitor How would you like it if I told everyone you were raped? He believed I had done something utterly despicable, blame wa pinned upon me by one of his siblings. In that moment something broke, the attack wa unwarranted. So much trust lost. When he figured out I had done nothing to him the apology came swift and numerous. - One wa when I asked him for a letter. He will always buy flower on special occasions, which I hate. They wither and die. I just hate the sentiment, I dislike it and I have communicated this. I wanted something which lasts. A reminder. All I wanted wa a letter. Years I secretly yearned for one but received flower instead, which I still tended to. Finally I asked for a letter. He refused and told me point blank to my face he would not. That it wa silly I needed something to hold onto, and that this item would become something of an unhealthy obsession. - The latest strike wa after I endured a panic attack while I wa on my own, which I managed myself before he returned home. He wa upset when I confided in him and he stated I will not be on your side if you are mentally ill. I will choose our child and make sure they grow up with stability. Later he corrected himself and stated that if I wa to turn schizophrenic or manic, he would have me committed and divorce me, but would support me through depression and anxiety . Now to me a panic attack is something manageable if you are equipped to deal with it. Through the year I have learned to be aware of my surroundings and trigger and to be prepared to deal with anything since I am responsible for my children. I have no history of hysterical or erratic behavior, so I found his reaction to my first ever panic attack very crude. I have my pride even through my depression for what I have survived and what I have accomplished. But I hate that I can not find it in myself again to open up towards my spouse and more than often find myself cry when I am capable to, so I can put up my smile and brave face when I NEED to. I have successfully faked it till I made it. And of the year that we have been together the good by far outweighs the bad, something which can not be conveyed well enough in this post. But what ha been said can be never taken back. Even though recently he said Do not you understand after year I am on your side? I understand. I hate that I cannot be vulnerable anymore. I hate that the trust is gone, and the resentment grows. If anyone ha advice or a similar story of lost trust, I would just love to hear and talk about it, if only to gain some perspective. Edit formatting

Lost my dad and my pet within the last two weeks. We took my dad to the hospital and found out he had a tumor in his colon. They removed it and several surgery later he wa in recovery, eating, and ready to come home. My mom spent day and night by his side for over a month at the hospital and refused to leave his side. Finally he wa recovering and they told her she can go home since they are transferring him to a hospital closer to us. She come home and the next morning we find out he died in his sleep from a heart attack. After surviving all the surgeries, he dy alone the same night my mom went home. On top of that, we did not get along well. I am not even sure he knew I cared about him. All the responsibility fell on me since both my parent were gone for a month. I did not have time to drive to the hospital he wa at. We had his memorial service and funeral.. then thing started to calm down. My mom and I spent time making the house spotless and reorganizing. I woke up this morning to find out that the cat I have had for - year got hit by a car. I buried him in a box outside our house and now I am just laying here, wondering if it is going to get any worse before it get better.

I know I am depressed but I have no energy to do anything to counter it. I have been searching for a job for month to no avail I used to have an office job for year before quitting it to take a leap of faith to migrate to another country , and from the second month onward, I have plunged deeper and deeper into depression. Back then in uni days, I wa diagnosed with clinical depression and wa put on medications. I have been off them since my graduation, because I did not want to depend on them for the rest of my life and I did not really have the fund to continue the treatment back then. These day I feel exactly like I am slogging through those low energy period again. My mind would never shut down at my usual bedtime and at time anxiety would keep me awake until or o clock in the morning. My biological clock is a total mess, in the morning I would just sleep in and refuse to wake up, even though it is already past noon. I tend to shy away from a much social interaction a possible I just plainly do not want to meet anyone, it freak me out and make me uncomfortable. I even refuse to answer any email or continue the dreary job searching and job application. I know that I am in a big mess. I disgust myself for my lack of energy and determination to do anything. But then when I am faced with the colossal task at hand, I would chicken out, then I would sleep on it, hoping that everything would somehow sort themselves out, only to find myself wake up in the next morning groggy and lethargic. Nothing ha changed, and I am still deep in depression.

Ca not fix anything in my life I am such a fundamentally broken person. I have want to say I have been fighting for years, but that a not true. All I can do is fucking run away from everything until the day is over. No action I take to improve myself can ever have weight because I am so goddamn broken that when I try to do something to better myself, it just reminds me of how much of a fucking loser I am. I cannot handle the fucking pain that come with self improvement. It is not fun in the least. It is humbling. Too humbling. And it just shove in my face all the time I have wasted and all of the experience I never had simply by virtue of being my self. Everyone who is happy act like life is just some natural occurrence. Like thing just happened to them and fell into place. This could not be further from the truth of my experience. Nothing ever just happens organically. Either I try hard and fail due to my lack of intelligence, or I do not do anything at all. It is hard to stay happy after constant failure and social rejection. I have never had interest or goal or relationship or friends. I never will. These thing do not just happen. You have to be a certain kind of person for them to happen. I am not that person. I will never be that person because I do not even know who I want to be, and if I figured that out I would be too insecure to become that. All I see in my future is homelessness and destitution because I came into adulthood with absolutely zero interests, special memories, or relevant helpful past experiences. My memory of my life in general is so goddam hazy at this point, if I ever did have those things, they have long been gone to the abyss. I just think why. Why do I have to be so broken and dysfunctional among everyone else? I am not even a real person. I am a complete shell of what could have been a person. This is too difficult to come to term with, while impossible to argue against. It is true. It is my reality. It honestly just make me angry, bitter, and jealous of others, at a very deep, fundamental, human level, for what the healthy people have. I fantasize about taking two AR-s and unloading on people. Maybe I know them, maybe I do not, it would not matter. Often life completely lose their value when my headspace get dark enough. Not a the result of an illness but of the fact that I am who I am both physically and psychologically. Blind rage. That is what the result of my dysfunction is. Pure fucking anger at both the world and myself. Unable to cope with my grim reality, all I want to do is destroy. The only thing I could ever really destroy is myself. The thought of my life slipping away becomes more attractive by the day a I see how impossible my desire are and how completely fruitless any effort to change is sure to be, just like it always has. I cannot handle the responsibility of being alive and I do not want to anymore. I am just here for the hedonistic pleasure life sometimes offers, until either I or something else kill me.
