Hi, I have posted a few response on the forum, but this will be my first thread. I guess I am wondering if I truly suffer from depression or another mental illness. I have not seen a psychologist or a therapist, but I have been reading your thread for the last few weeks. My heart go out to you and I wish that I could lend more support than I can. I know that my situation is not nearly a dire a many of you, but I still ponder whether I have a iproblemi. For the last couple of years, I have experienced an increase in mood swings. I will be doing fine and then a ilight switchi go off, and I get a bad case of the blues. These can last for a few of days. In my mind, I know that everything is actually okay, but I cannot shake the idowni feeling. I also have frequent bout of being istressed-outi. By this I mean that all of the task that I need to get done seem to be insurmountable and that there will never be enough time to get thing done. I sometimes break down in tear during my more manic attack of frustration and worry. Life seems to have become one long list of stuff to do. Even the fun stuff ha become something to get done so that I can move on to the next day. As for itriggersi, a I have been reading about in your posts, I know that I have two major issues. I do not deal well with my emotion when my husband get angry not abusive, just normal iguy angryi or I feel that I have somehow iscrewed-upi and let him down by not doing something right. I turn very inward and the ilight switchi go off. My second issue deal with embarrassment. I do not take embarrassment well. My stress anxiety over getting the housework done stem from my concern that people may come over and I will be embarrassed by the state of the house in fact, the house is always neat and clean, if a bit disheveled by daily life . I often worry about whether I embarrassed myself during social outing or at party with my friends. My husband reassures me, but that doe not usually ease my worry. My ObGyn gave me Sarafem Prozac mg three week ago, and I seem to be operating on a more even keel these days. The low are not a low and I seem to be able to let more stuff just roll off my back. I am pleased with the results, and my husband ha seen a real improvement, but I am still asking myself the basic question a to whether I am indeed ill. Please provide some feedback if you can, a this is the first time that I have tried to really tell folk about how I feel.

It can be a amazing a the the clear blue water surrounding a tropical island. It could be a mundane a a flock of bird flying in harmony over your roof. Sure, there are a lot of really shitty thing that we go through, but there are those breathtaking moment you have yet to experience. Those moment where you think damn, it really is nice to be alive.

Beautifully Broken I have spent most of my life afraid to be my true self because I believed that if I did not live up to the standard and norm that I grew up with, I would not be accepted. I wa told since a young age how I should act, talk, and dress. I wa told that money wa important and that attending societal event and bullshit ball wa your key to social success. And those things, trying to feel important, had meant everything to me. But then life screw you over and suddenly your perspective on everything changes. I learned that I no longer wanted to be the person that everyone said I had to be and thing that had once seemed important became trivial. I realized that I did not give a fuck if I had Tory Burch shoe or a Chanel bag. No amount of money could ever bring me happiness, which wa clearly evident in the money that wa spent on I am sorry shopping trip and my therapist. Things started falling apart at home when I wa year old. So my remedy to broken family wa to drink until I could not feel. But despite my new fond love of alcohol and it pain killing effects, I kept my life together. I worked hard in school, I stayed active in my community, and I made sure people thought I wa keeping it together. I could not let everyone know that I wa a fucking mess. But in this process, I slowly lost myself and started living two different lives. When the curtain were wide open, people saw a girl that wa very studious, had many accomplishment is, and always had a smile on her face. But a soon a the curtain closed and I wa alone, my demon came out. And the more I hid, the more I lost myself. At one point, the alcohol wa not enough. Things had only gotten worse at home and I needed a new escape. The first time I did it, it wa a pair of scissors. It wa small, barely noticeable. I had sworn after the first time that I would never hurt myself again. But eventually I did, and when I left for college it had only gotten worse. By my second year of college, I had reached my lowest point. I wa in a toxic, emotionally abusive, relationship. I had a broken relationship with my parents, who spent most of their time stuck in a cycle of fighting, not speaking, and then pretending that they were okay. I had not spoken to my older brother, a struggling addict at the time, in almost a year. I no longer knew who I was. So one night I went out and bought a bottle of wine with my fake ID and went back to my apartment and chugged the entire thing. I sat on my bathroom floor crying, staring at the knife in my hand. And in the back of my mind I thought about the gun that wa a few foot away from me hidden in a book that my dad had given me for protection. For the first time in my life, I had looked at mortality straight in the face. I had questioned it many times, but it wa never like that night. Eventually the cry stopped and the numbness came, a feeling I had become all too familiar with. Would I do it? Could I do it? Would anyone care? I wa consumed with darkness, but there wa a small flicker of light, of hope. I wanted to help people, I wanted to one day to change the world, or at the very least change one person is life. I wa not ready to leave just yet, so I held on to the tiny amount of hope that wa left in me. I called the cop and wa admitted into a psychiatric center. I spent hour in a white walled, emotionless, prison like place. And not once did someone ask me if I wa okay. My parent came up to see me and had a difficult time accepting what had happened and I did not understand why. They knew I wanted help, they saw the scar on my arms, and they knew that I wa not okay. They blamed my relationship with my then boyfriend and told me to never speak of this to anyone. They did not want people to know I wa crazy . Was I? During that time, I came to believe I was, but now I understand that I wa just broken. It is been over three year since that happened and although I still struggled with a lot after that, I am now in a better place. The reason I am writing this is because I promised myself to one day help the -year-old me whose cry for help where tossed to the side, who wa told she wa over-dramatic and crazy, and who thought that cutting wa the only way to cope. There wa a reason I grew up surrounded by mental illness. I watched not only myself go through it, but I saw my brother, my parents, my friends, and so many people on the news struggling with their own demons. And this did not happen because life felt like fucking me over, it wa just trying to show me what my reason for living is. I spent year ashamed of the person I wa because I wa scared to show people my true, raw, fucked up self. But is not that the problem? When it come to having a mental illness, we believe the stigma that come attached to it and we are afraid to speak up and talk about it. And the people who are lucky enough to not experience it, do not want to talk about it either. The only difference from how mental illness wa treated a hundred year ago and now, is that we no longer hide and chain our family member in basement or attics, but the shame and embarrassment is still there. And I want to change that. I want to remove the stigma and stereotype attached to mental illness and get people talking. But change start with me, and that mean that I cannot be afraid to share my experiences. This is who I am and I would not change my life for anything in the world because now I truly understand what it is like to live with a mental illness. I finally know what the difference between sympathy and empathy is, and that is one of the greatest gift that could have come out from this. I will be exploring different topic on mental illness while trying to find way to change the way people think and talk about it. I will not only be looking at the psychological background of mental illness, but the neurological background a well. More and more scientist are publishing article on different alternative treatment that do not involve medications. One of my favorite topics, which I will soon explore in more detail, is neuroplasticity, or the brain way of re-wiring itself to create new circuits, and essentially a new you. I have set a goal to one day create a facility for those who are afflicted with a mental illness. But instead of white walls, cold stare from employees, and isolation, they will be surrounded by beautiful colors, the outdoors, and people who actually care. Our current mental health system is completely and utterly fucked up. We cannot keep over-medicating people and throwing them out into the world with absolutely no regard for their actual well-being. If these treatment were actually working, we would not be seeing an alarmingly increasing rate of mental illness. It is time to re-define mental illness and stick a middle finger up to all the people who tell you that you are crazy or different. And maybe I am crazy, I am sure a hell different, but that doe not make me any le of a person. I am proud of who I have become and now I know what the purpose of my life is, and I am not going to stop chasing it. -RBZ Sometimes the most beautiful people are beautifully broken -r.m. drake

Medicines can and do stop working. I am going though this right now. I suffer from chronic depression. Had it since I wa and I am now so I have been suffering for years. God, I never realized how long it was! I sat in therapy for year after my ex attempted to hang himself. I saved his life by taking him down from the noose with the help of my brother. The first word out of his mouth when he wa out of his coma and the swelling went down wa that it wa all my fault. I knew then it wa ME who needed the help. So for year I sat in therapy and they never diagnosed me with chronic depression. If they did, they never told me or put me on medicines. When I switched therapists, that wa when she said that I needed medicines. They gave me Prozac. That made a HUGE difference after the first weeks. I took that for years. Then I had gastric bypass surgery and when you have that, your body doe not absorb the same so it stopped working. I took effexor for a while, did nothing, and now on celexa which is doing nothing at all. I am sitting here reading this forum and crying. So basically, medicine CAN stop working. Time to go get an adjustment.

Doing thing that I like reminds me why I do not enjoy doing them anymore. Playing your favorite game? You should not. Remember the time you shut yourself in just to play it endlessly? When nothing else mattered but your game? Finished reading a cool book? Are you going to pick up another one and get sucked in again? Do not forget your friends. Why would you hang out with your friend when they are tired of your negative attitude? Faking a positive attitude is worse. If you are going to be yourself just stay home. Oh you got selected for a great job opportunity? Wait until they realize you are garbage at your job. You have time to relax now? Think again. There is always someone needing something or thing that need to be done. Trying to treat yourself? Wait until you see the consequence from buying too many thing or eating too much or wasting time. You are actually being responsible and starting work early? Wait until you feel like nothing is worth it anymore. Why doe it matter to do thing you like if you are just going to feel bad anyways? I have been conditioned to believe these thing since I started college and I feel stuck. I am trying to deny that I believe in these things, but the thought keep coming back. I know that I should take care of myself, but I am so tired of living that I am hesitant to do anything for myself.

Told my mother I tried to kill myself, she admitted she also tried when i wa a baby. I have been struggling with this sickness for a while, it cost me my job, and a few friends, but only now i can publicly say that i tried to kill myself on the th of February. I tried to hang myself with a belt, fortunatelly i bought a really shitty one at primark and the only thing it did wa leave me on the floor gasping desperatelly for air, filled with a sense of failure and a huge shame. I have always been an outgoing, funny, talkative and very active guy and i just felt a is i runned out of batery like something wa leaving me without lifeforce. After some therapy i decided to tell my mother about this. I went for a visit to my parent house and waited until we were alone to tell her basically what i have been writing above. Also told her that the biggest fear i had before doing it wa that if i died my mother would also died just out of pure sadness. After we both cried for a while she dropped the bomb. She had been struggling with depression all her life without me or my sister knowing about it and it came a point where she even tried of doing the same. The thing that stopped her wa their child and what we would do with and year alone. She also told me that my grandfather did not die of cancer, apparently he wa an alcoholic, and when we where kid he threw himself at the well they had on the backyard. All this just made me realize that people do not kill themselves, depression kill people the same way cancer does. People who have not struggled with this cannot even imagine what is living with depression and often blame a person who is basically ill. My mother also gave me the best advice i have ever recieved. She told me that I wa not on this earth just to find a job and live the best way i could just by buying things, that it did not matter if i did not find a huge reason to live just by being there i wa already the reason for my mother and many others to live and be happy, the same way she wa for me. That even just by smiling at the guy at the supermarket i wa already making him a bit happier even though it would only be a few seconds, and that should be enough. Thanks for listening guy

After a year of therapy I started feeling worse about myself and developed an eating disorder and a few month ago I also started feeling more and more depressed. At first I denied everything and even threatened to quit therapy because I wa convinced time would heal me..well I now know that healing is not that easy. over the past two week I have been to a psychiatrist who want to start me on Prozac because it should not make me gain weight, she think this would be the best ad. for me and earlier this week i went to see my usual psychotherapist who said I wa severely depressed and she urged me to start taking the medication because of my state of mind. I hope I can find the energy to read more message on this board and maybe get a good feeling about life again. Bye for now, Sarah

Hi all.. this is going to be a long post, but I would really like some feedback on it.. I am kind of young, . I am currently involved in a relationship long distance with a boy who is a year older than me, and I love him more than word can say. The thing is, though, I am a very depressed person sometimes. I do not know if I am making this up or if I actually read this somewhere, but I am what I have heard classified a a seasonally depressed person I experience depression more during the winter month December through February than I do any other time of the year. I have a lot of family problem that compound to my depression a well. When I wa , I moved halfway across the country and I never accepted living here. I am a city-girl, but I moved to the country. I feel isolated and alone out here, and I do not have anyone to talk to. My mother told me to buck up and get over it when I went to her about my depression a couple of year ago. She is currently on medication for her own depression. My father ha a crippled arm which he gained when we moved here and ha some addiction problems, so I do not go to him. I have a very hard time trusting people. My mother and father were both abused a children, and my mother verbally abuse me. Recently, starting in about December, I started wanting to hurt myself physically again. The urge faded, but the depression lingered. For a while I have been emulating my mother on my boyfriend--I keep taking out my own anger and my own depression on him. I am afraid that if I keep up with this behavior, I am going to lose my boyfriend to my own selfishness. A lot of the time I wish I could disappear. I do not like being seen by people and I like to be alone, but at the same time I feel isolated in my soul. I tried religion, but I cannot bring myself to place my faith in something I cannot see. I am really afraid that my depression is going to cause me to lose the one thing I even care about at all anymore in the world. I do not know what to do. My parent will not help me, my teacher do not know how to deal with it, and I have been to depression forum like this before and they really helped. I guess all I am looking for is someone to lean on while I get through the winter months. If anyone ha any suggestion for a homebody my parent do not allow me to leave the house after school is over , please let me know. Also keep in mind that I cannot call people very easily with eavesdropping people in my house. Thanks. Sarina

This message is especially for newcomer desperately seeking a way out of the depression rut. Please read my word carefully a a lot of thought and devotion went into this A year ago, I wa stuck in the miserable rut of depression with little or no hope of finding a way out. I wa attending mandatory group therapy after an attempted suicide and miserable hour in the nut house. They put me on Remeron which helped a little .. taking some of the edge off the suicidal thoughts, but little else. Weeks of trying to learn cognitive behavior therapy went by and hope of getting better were dwindling. Then one day, my best friend gave me a book which taught me how to properly apply the CBT. Many of you have tried CBT to no avail. I sincerely believe that you did not do it either properly, hard enough, and or long enough. When retraining the mind, it is vitally important to diligently apply CBT daily for several weeks. See my webpage for more info Antidepressant That Works . Once this becomes a regular habit, I am confident you will see improvement a I did. I am positive you can do it too. It wa the toughest job I have ever had to do, but it sure wa worth it. Whenever a negative situation present itself now, I just block it out and replace it with a positive thought automatically. It is hard in the beginning, but it is totally do - able. Plus, it get easier after awhile. Then, once it becomes automatic, you do not even have to think about it. Properly applied CBT help tremendously, but it is not a complete cure a you will see in my story. You must also take care of your body because it is what furnishes your brain with the proper nutrients. The two go hand in hand. The brain regulates the endocrine system and the neurotransmitter while the body provides the brain with the proper chemical to do it job. Leisure activity help also. I know it is difficult for some of you to have fun, but it is important to get your mind off your problem even if just for a little while. I mention motivation in my story. Sometimes you just have to force yourself to do what is good for you even if you do not want to. Contrary to what many believe, motivation begin with action .. not visa - versa. The sooner you begin to properly apply the technique I learned and the more effort you put in to them, the sooner you will get better. Hopelessness and doubt will be your enemy, so try to put them aside for a month a you get on the road to wellness. I have been off antidepressant for almost a year now. I feel great .. plus my concentration and comprehension are back. March marked my one year anniversary without alcohol too. I am basically drug free and am a happy a I wa year ago before the depression nearly ruined my life.

When did you decide to get help? What wa the tipping point? I am been having thought and feeling lately and I want to compare them to when other people decided to take the plunge. I need to get this out. Feel free to ignore it. Potential Triggers Domestic and parental abuse, self harm, bullying, substance abuse etc. Avoiding detail AMAP I am so sick of trying to just survive each day. I want more than anything to go out and live my life. I want a job, an apartment, a pet.. but instead I am stuck living with my grandparent because I am at the point where my agoraphobia is so bad I can BARELY leave my bed. I do not think I have felt happy for more than minute at any given time in the last months. I applied to try to get a tattoo to cover some scar I have from when I got really bad, but they never contacted me again..so that reminder is always there making me feel sick and myself and taunting me to do it again just to numb the crap in my head. I am trying to be a partner to this amazing guy I care a ton about, but I feel so emotionally shut down that I do not even react to joke or love anymore. I do not even like when he cuddle me because his breath on my neck is a trigger.. Now, I do not have it a bad a a lot of other people. I grew up in a family with a loving OCD grandmother, a grandfather, and a drug addict mother who all always made sure I had food and a place to sleep. That alone is more than a lot of people get..but every time I try to talk to someone and they do not respond to me I flip out at them because my mom did not want me to interrupt her high. When something go SLIGHTLY wrong or is a SMIDGE out of place I panic because that is all I had around me. I am new here. I am from Australia, I am year old next month, married with a . year - old daughter and a baby son on the way. I work in Insolvency liquidation etc . I have been on antidepressant medication on and off for about year now initially Aropax, now Aurorix , in hindsight I have actually suffered from depression for my entire life. I am a similar personality to my mother who also suffers from depression. My younger brother and sister seem to have drawn the long straw a such, they seem not to be affected. Things went downhill for me about the time I started on medication. I wa in the early stage of a major gambling problem, and untreated depression had led to a real strain on my marriage. We split up for month during which time I made lame suicide attempt , reunited and seemed to get back on track, having our first child. Throughout this time the gambling problem intensified, and spiraled out of control to the point where I am now a bankrupt. During this time I also became extremely withdrawn to the point where I hate leaving our house and am more or le unable to cope with spending time with anyone except my wife and daughter. I also had something of a breakdown about month ago, quit my job, which led to great tension between me and my wife spending together , eventually she could not cope and moved out. Shortly after we worked it out and I moved in with her. Things seem pretty good now, we are a lot more relaxed about thing and we just seem to get along better, looking forward very much to the birth of our second, in about week time. My gambling problem is pretty much dealt with thanks chiefly to having little money and no access to it now but I am still depressed, withdrawn and generally tired of life. To be honest, I am only around because of my wife and daughter, I feel little reason to exist other than for them. I am also a christian and this is very hard, because there is a real burden of I should not feel this way, I should be happy . This lead to more depression, and at the moment I am reluctant to go to church, I do not pray or read the bible. I am generally resentful of anyone who I consider to have a better existence than me which is just about everyone . So while thing are quite stable at home, I personally am at my lowest point in some respects. I am quite intelligent and every employer I have ever had ha commented on my abundance of potential but lack of drive. So true, I lack any kind of ambition and harbor something of an extreme opposition to materialism and the pursuit of money and possession and even now am tossing up whether to continue working. I have a chief interest i.e. motorsport , but other interest have been decimated e.g. I used to be quite a good pianist but now have absolutely no desire to play. I also cannot get the motivation up to get involved in playing sport, which in the past ha been a big part of my life. So that is me in a nutshell. My extreme difficulty in taking on face to face help relationship ha driven me to get involved in some online depression forum a I think this may be a good way for me to start some kind of recovery.

Things that I liked about today so far Maybe the only way to escape depression is gratitude. Cicero, one of the senator of Rome in the early day of the empire is quoted to have said Gratitude is not only the greatest of virtues, but the parent of all the others. I liked waking up early and going to the gym on an intense pre workout. I like stepping outside in the cold to smoke and feel the warmth when I re-enter the building. I like seeing the tree trying to survive the winter, how splendorous they are. In them I see people going through hard time and the beauty that exists within them. I liked logging on to Runescape to escape reality for a couple of hour and talking to my friend on there. The fact that we have escape is an amazing thing. I liked seeing three girl meet each other outside and say Hii how are youu? and compliment each other. Instead of normally being irritated by that, I actually admired that people in reality share bond and happiness with each other is presence, and it made me happy to see that. I like the complexity of the mathematics that I am doing and the fact that I am doing it. I like having a planned meeting with a group of people today for my class presentation in college. I like having a picture of a God who constantly forgives and is deeply saddened by our unhappiness that becomes to hard to bear for some, versus a picture of an angry Colonel with zero mercy. I like the fact that I have a place to resort to to write down the thought streaming from my mind. I like the caprese sandwich I am eating, with melted mozzarella, tomato, red peppers, pesto sauce.

People are NOT who they seem. I originally wrote a long post detailing the specific of what just happened to me, but I decided not to. All I am saying is, do not trust anybody. You have zero assurance that people who act nice and fine when you are around are really nice and fine towards you when your back is turned. I would not have known the true, judgmental, and frankly I have no fucking idea where in the as of God did they pull all their judgmental shit - if I had not snooped and read text message of my mother to other people. Hell, my own mother is in it, too! Hide the knife, he might stab our son my stepfather . You are sick, go to a doctor for a checkup. You cannot give up, please do not die. We pity your son. He cannot survive without you. He will burn all the money with booze. He will be homeless and sleep on the streets. Jesus Fucking Christ. What in the actual fuck? I do not even drink. Jesus Christ. What the fuck. The judgment. Dear fucking Christ I could not believe nor comprehend how this people even came to whatever bullshit thought idea they came to. Suddenly, I am back down to self-doubt and I can feel depression clawing at me, it is trying to rip me apart again. But, no more. I am pushing it back. I have confirmed EVERYTIME, that family is my main source of toxicity. FUCK THAT. I am being ganged up on by everyone in this house, and their relatives, and every single one of my relatives. I once questioned if I wa the one at fault. I mean, if EVERYBODY hated you, you are probably doing something wrong. UNLESS, you are just that damn unlucky and every single one of your relative is a fucking asshole. I have heard of those story before, so it is not impossible - and I think that is the case with me. Jesus. For now, I am playing the game they wanna play. They wanna be fake with me, I will be fake with them. I act all fine and dandy around my mother and everyone else. I smile, I joke. All a facade. So when the right time comes, when I can finally burn bridge with them, it will fucking hurt mom. Mom, yes. Because everyone else would be glad I am gone. But, my mother, will hopefully finally realize her fucking mistake and die a fucking failure of a mother.

Hey dad, I am full of regret and turmoil ugh just get over it well excuse me sir for being by the reality that I just pulled a mulan and cut all my hair off so that I could get another job. I went from having shoulder length hair that made me feel good about myself to hair that is half an inch long and highlight everything about my face that give me horrible anxiety. Maybe I am really hurting because I went in to work yesterday and two of my manager greeted me with ew gross, what happened to your hair? And now I feel like I am a ugly a I think I am. My boring sob story Family member told me all the time that being an adult is shit and I should make the most of being a kid. So when depression hit me I thought it wa normal, but it did not feel right. I wa not upset all the time, it wa just like a flat misery sort of feeling. Things started to feel odd for me, certain sound and smell and silly thing like the wind of my face felt wrong. Like they would be toned down somehow. Eventually I became completely disconnected from my emotions, save for the occasional moment when I actually find something funny. I have been on two type of medication and had therapy too, neither of which did anything for me. I did not notice myself become so gradually withdrawn from everything. Now going to the shop or getting the bus is something I would rather not do. Things I would do every day. My social life went backwards a well a my social skills. Now I am afraid to talk to people. I literally reject girl I am interested in on the spot, before I even have chance to fuck it up myself. Things that I would do without thinking now take encouragement and energy. Then came the cynicism. Belief that nobody out there wa pure and everything they did wa for their own personal gain. Suppose it is true in a sense but I wish I did not have this paint everybody with the same brush mindset. It is hard to believe I am the same person at times. It is been year now and I have had enough. Just dunno what to do. I feel like I have tried everything. Ca not help but feel I am partly responsible, for buying into the shit I told myself.

Does anyone else dread going to bed at night because you are forced to be alone with your thoughts? But when I am laying in bed trying to sleep I am forced to be alone with myself and actually think about things. It sucks.

I am okay, until I have to be alone with my thoughts. I enjoy the company of my friends, even though I am very bad at talking to them. When I am out with them or rehearsing with my band I feel okay. I almost feel depression free for the time being I feel like everything will be okay, that I got this, that I am in control, that it doe not matter that I have a lot of homework due in the next week cause I will go home and get it done. I feel strong and motivated. And then I have to go home. I am no longer in the company of people who love me, so I start feeling anxious. I start believing they actually fucking hate me. I lose it. I hate being alone because my horrible thought are a lot easier to hear over the silence of no one talking.

I am a hetero man, , divorced, no kids. I can honestly say that I feel empathy towards any guy who suffers from depression. Some of my closest guy friend have admitted to me their many bout of battling these demons, just a I have shared my horror story and near suicidal incidents, and we all have empathy with each other over that stuff. I am beginning to not give a crap anymore about depression being viewed a just a woman issue it is what it is and to heck with gender stereotypes. The thing I have noticed the most are my friend unwillingness to consult a therapist or take medication, but perhaps their bout of depression are not the bed-ridden variety that I have gone through. Or maybe this is their way of not feeling completely weak . Most of my friend will either drink excessively or take drug to deal with this stuff. I tried to drink it all away, but in the end it just made me feel worse. I tried tranquilizers, but that did not work. I tried booze and pill together, but still the depression lingered. Now I just smoke cigarette and go running what a dichotomy, I know but whatever works, right? The only woman I have ever known who is not empathetic or sympathetic to my depression is my mother.

The Irony of Loneliness in an Overpopulated World As I spend more time in the presence of depression, I have tried to apply a further focus to understand what is actually going on in my head. Dealing with the sudden appearance of depression ha been a nightmare and a half to deal with to say the least. So in response, I regularly attempt to interpret the spiral of self loathing thought and whirlwind of emotion that march throughout my mind. My initial reaction to a diagnosis of major depression and multiple failed suicide attempt ha been to run away from everything that reek of painful memories, both theoretically and literally I write this post , kilometre from my home country, in Japan, where I aim to live for the next couple of years. I have ghosted those whom I use to call my close friends. I left all social medium in order to avoid contacting people that I knew, and because looking at how happy other people were brought me down. I changed my image drastically over the past year a an outward expression of the fact that I am trying to change a a person. It is here in Japan that I have come to a terrifying realisation. I cannot run from depression. Here I am, in a country where people speak a totally different language and immersed in a totally different culture to my own, writing a post about depression. Recently, I wa walking the street in search for job opportunity when I sunk into a depressed mood and began thinking about my place in the world which always turn out well . Nothing actually matters. We work in order to pay rent, in order to stay in the same place, so that we can reliably keep a job so that we can pay rent. It is in this meaninglessness that human a social being look to others for comfort. Our life are but a meaningless speck in an expanding universe. That is quite the depressing thought.. And it is. But why is it that when another body is lying on top of mine, or when I am held in a warm embrace, this thought doe not have any impact on me? I have done quite a bit of thinking by myself, and have talked to a bunch of people from back in the psychiatric ward on what fix us. And the unfortunate answer for most of u is.. Nothing. We cannot be fixed. It is just how our mind work. But what if we do not have to be fixed? The hardest part about depression for me, is the intensity of the loneliness I feel. When I am at my worst, I am so focused on my own loneliness and the meaninglessness of my relationships, that the few connection I do have, I dismiss. Now, this is not the case for all people suffering from depression. For a lot of people, their negative emotion are driven by a sense of worthlessness, meaninglessness or sadness. But the general consensus is, although we cannot fix ourselves, we can have people around u to support u when we are at our lowest. And it make sense that a social beings, human intimacy provides u with a safety net for when depression is hitting u the hardest. Unfortunately for most of us, the type of physical and emotional intimacy that we strive for is unobtainable. In my life, depression is caused me to push away the people that I have spent time building connection with, and ha limited the amount of contact I have had with stranger and people that I COULD connect with. I think it is ironic. It is ironic that in such an overpopulated world, depression is such a big issue. We are the people that need intimacy the most, so you would think we would be in a position where intimacy is more readily available. But that is not how the world works. Our life are still meaningless. We still hate ourselves. And we are still alone.

Why depression is, and is not like a skinned knee Some thought I had that I wanted to share I wa just pondering depression, and I decided to jot down what I wa thinking. It is sort of a good way to put word to what it feel like to suffer from depression. Why it IS like a skinned knee Depression usually come in episode for me, and a lot of people I have talked to. Sometimes I will be doing okay, and then have a really bad day, or even a bad week. These episode are sort of like skinning your knee. When you were little, skinning your knee feel like the absolute worst thing in the world. You think, OW, THIS HURTS SO MUCH! WHAT S HAPPENING TO ME?! You feel so helpless. When you are an adult and skin your knee, you know what to do. You know that you are supposed to clean it, and put a bandage on it. And that is exactly what you do you do not make a fuss. But, even though you clean it and bandage it, it is of course still going to hurt. It is a cut. You just ignore the pain, though, because you have already taken care of it, and there is not much else you can do beyond that. You just have to live with the fact that it is going to hurt for a while. Depression is the exact same way. When it happens, you know what you should do to handle it. The best way, backed by science and research, is what we have all heard countless time Exercise, eat healthy, do something nice for yourself, clean your living space, listen to happy music, watch TV show that make you happy, etc. So you know to do this stuff. But of course, it is not going to magically feel better right off the bat. There is still that emotional pain there, just like the way a skinned knee stings. But you have already done everything you can to take care of it, so you have to live with it and wait patiently for the pain to go away. Why depression ISN T like a skinned knee Most people know that depression ha a way of demotivating sufferers. Things you once enjoyed no longer interest you. Nothing seems like it ha a point. But this also affect your drive to treat your depression. When you skin your knee, you just take care of it right away, you do not give any second thought to it. It is just what you do. With depression, you know that you should be exercising, eating healthy, listening to happy music, cleaning, etc. But you do not. What is the point? The difference is, that depression make you NOT want to get better, or more accurately, not care about getting better. Sometimes, you are just apathetic and nihilistic, What is the point? I do not care. Getting better is too much effort. Sometimes, you just want to wallow in your own despair. For me, when I feel this way, it is because I feel worthless and self-loathing. I think, I deserve to feel this way. I deserve this emotional pain that I am going through. I do not deserve to feel better, or to be happy. That is the vicious cycle that depression us to keep you down. If you are reading this and have depression, I hope this help you understand your own illness a little more clearly. If you are reading this and you do not have depression, I hope this give you a good account of what it is like, so you can empathize with people who have depression. Stay safe, everyone.

Falling for someone you have no chance to be with Warning Super long read Have you ever fallen for someone that you know you have absolutely no chance with? It is been year since I have fallen for a girl back in college, which ended up in heartbreak and depression because she already found someone else. I have lost all motivation and my passion for art I am an art student , failed my thesis which sent me into another dark place, friend were not even there to help me get up, and for the remaining year I had in college, the thing that kept me going are my parents, I just wanted to survive for them. I have lost all emotions, the flame that wa once burning in my heart, the excitement I had when I wa a freshman. I graduated college month ago and found work not related to the course I took up, it felt really low, but I just wanted to survive. Training for work now, did not want to make friend again, had one, but he did not liked the people so he left in a few weeks, the only thing in my mind wa to focus and be better for this job to survive. Avoided lunch and hanging out with workmates, and did not really reveal much about myself aside from having a mundane life. The trainer were aware of my introversion and decided to have random sitting arrangement every week so we could get to know our workmate more, and I could get to talk about other stuff aside from work. week in training and still, I did not made any connections, I only help out my workmate professionally, point out mistake and the next step they should take. I get to be sit mate with the liveliest girl in training, playful and have a contagious happy aura ? . There were also a few talk and laugh about work related stuff, but I did not really made effort to start it, she wa always the one that engages first and that is because she is an extrovert and doe this to everyone anyways . Being around her, hearing her voice, seeing her smile felt something, it felt like the flame that I lost year ago came back. But, what made me fell the most is that she is intelligent a well and speaks in English flawlessly I live in a country outside US . I can also relate to her because she suffers from clinical depression and requires therapy session every now and then everyone in training know this anyways because she told the class from the get-go . I did not really asked her out for lunch or coffee, I really wanted to so I could get to know her better and be friend with her, be her guide in her darkest days, but my introversion and over thinking always get the best of me. There were only a few time she joined me and my friend during a coffee break where I found out a few thing about her. There were time that I see the sadness beyond her smile, and time where her depression wa clearly visible and affected me greatly. I always think about scenario - if the condition were right - where I get to talk with her and lend a helping hand, at the end of the day they only remain a thoughts. I know she doe not think about me like how I think about her. Every time our shift ends, I leave the office quickly and ignore the feeling I have for her, my mind is at a constant battle on whether or not to ask her for lunch, ask her if she is ok. It is even worse at night, whenever I see her late night tweet about her depression, a part of me just want to be there for her, and the other part give me the realization of how pathetic I am and that I do not deserve her. I know that she had an ex-bf that broke her heart, and currently ha a gf she is bi . Yet, she still give me inspiration in every photo I take. I really do not know what is wrong with me, I am being tormented by my own mind and I still like it. Knowing that she already ha someone in her heart, yet still seeing her depressed at time and looking at her tweet , really make me want to step up and do something, but held back by my own tormented soul. Next week would be the last week in training, after that we are going to get split up into team and do actual work, but still go back to class to share our experience and reflect upon them. One could only hope for a miracle that I gain the strength and courage to talk to her more and be a part of her life. I really hate this feeling, yet this pain fuel my passion even more.

Only I find that whenever I spend time with a friend, they end up annoying the shit out of me. Each one for a different reason. One talk about herself too much, one is too positive and gushy, one only ever talk about the past, the other only want to hang out and drink. When I am with them, I just find myself wishing I could be alone. I know the problem is with me, and that I am sabotaging my relationship a I always do and have done for many year . I feel guilty about it, especially knowing that I am lucky to even have friends. But the truth is, I find people exhausting, and whenever I am with them I just feel lonelier that when I am alone. I end up getting snappy. It is like I am watching myself destroy my relationship but I do not know how to stop. Hanging out with people make me unhappy. Beginning to think I should become a hermit out in the wood on my own. I do not know why I posted this. I suppose I just want to tell somebody.

So I finally realized something this week.. Been stuck in an episode since my birthday just turned , a per my last post . Ca not remember the last time I ate a proper meal. Sleep cycle is fucked. Have not left the house in a week. Funny enough, I had planned on hanging out and doing some reading in a cafe today.. only to never leave the house. All this time, I have been thinking how much I yearn to have someone, anyone, physically check in. Or a partner to cuddle with, hug, and hold me tight.. but all that just fade into the empty void. Ultimately, I have to physically do thing by myself. No one is gonna save me. It is heartbreaking. Physically, I am just so alone.

I am in a reflective mood today. I received a phone call this afternoon from the sister of my old neighbor, who I will call Alice. She had passed away this morning. Alice had been fighting terminal colon cancer since March and after harsh chemo therapy and a bout with pneumonia that landed her in the ICU, she decided that enough wa enough. She stopped treatment just around the July th weekend. I am not too exact on the details, but suffice it to say that she failed quickly after that and passed away in her sleep this morning surrounded by family and friends. She wa only . As I struggle with Depression, AD HD, tic disorders, sleep apnea, insomnia, food allergies, pollen allergies, and a weak immunity system I sometimes feel that life is unfair. I used to say that the Universe wa out to get me, that God is having his little joke with me. I suppose it is only natural to feel that way. It is a full plate and I am not too hungry for what is on the menu. Then I encounter other people with other hardship and I see that life itself is not fair to an awful lot of people. Life is, in fact, a lousy chef. What struck me a sad today, however, wa not simply the passing of somebody I knew. Instead I wa struck with my own mortality and weakness. Let me explain. Alice and some other neighbor had not been too kind to me when I moved into the area. They had accused me of various deviant behavior that to this day still anger me. These were supposed to be my Christian brother and sister and instead they wielded stones. The rumor mounted a the month progressed, wilder and wilder, until they reached a crescendo where they became so outlandish that it wa easy to disprove them. When all the furor amounted to nothing a lot of people were left with egg on their face. That summer several of the family involved moved away. I have unresolved issue with them, but with Alice, my neighbor, I wa able to find forgiveness in my heart. The story did not end happily there with u arm in arm, though. Alice never really apologized to me, though her behavior towards my family and myself became kinder. Unfortunately, she wa one of the people I knew who did not believe in AD HD. One day she told me her opinion on the subject right to my face after I mentioned I had it. I wa so stunned by her bold opinion that I stood there slack jawed. I swore that day I would never let that happen to me again. You see a bit of that fire in this blog whenever anybody accuses me of not having a real problem. I am a fierce in person a well. Thanks to Alice. And now she is passed on. Suddenly my anger feel petty and shallow. She moved away and now ha died, but I allowed her to change me. I nursed a wound like an angry coal in my heart. I forgave her for one thing, but held a grudge for another. She became representative of all the doubter in my life and I used that a impetus for change. What type of person doe that make me? On top of that, I have set lofty goal for myself that are proving hard to meet. Time is ticking and my th birthday is but a scant five month away. One of the byproduct of meeting those goal wa to have a book with my name on it that I could bring into her elementary school classroom one day, slam on her desk, and say Ha! - a if my success would mean anything to her. As if that would prove my struggle with AD HD wa real. How silly. How foolish. Alice wa only thirteen year older than I. I can blink and be tomorrow. Mortality laugh at me and replaces all of life is menu item with sour grape and rotten eggs. What shall I order now? Usually, my sense of humor keep my spirit alight. Today, however, I see myself a being revealed a a small-minded man with insignificant goals. That even for a moment, no matter how miniscule, I wa sad she died before my goal were met.. This both sickens me and splash me in the face with a brisk dose of reality. December loom and I read news? Time leak through my finger and I am worried about a drop in comment on my blog? How did I get so turned around? Where did I get so terribly sidetracked? I need to remember what it is I want out of life. It is not to show up the doubter but to find joy in my own accomplishments. I know that, but negative thought attache itself to our most noble intention like a parasite. Allow it to stay too long and it consumes and replaces what wa once good and uplifting. I do not resent Alice. I never wished her ill. But I regret I let myself hold a grudge, however slight it seemed. Life is too short for such things. So I will allow Alice to change me again. That way when I order from the menu of life it will not be just desserts.

Opened up to a friend about my depression. It could have gone better. Hello, Reddit. I have never posted here before. I am a bit nervous about sharing this story I am very shy, even anonymously , so I want to thank you in advance for taking the time to read it. I am hoping that just getting it off my chest will help, even if only a little. Also, I am sorry if this post ramble on a bit or is incoherent at all, I am not in the best state of mind at the moment. Earlier today, during our school is lunch break, I opened up to somebody I trusted about my depression and anxiety. I have been on a steep downward spiral recently, and this person had taken notice that something wa wrong. She sat me down, grabbed u a couple of sodas, and told me to spill my guts. Normally, I would have simply told her that everything wa fine, and made some lame excuse like I did not sleep well last night or I am just worried about my exam score . But this wa the first time that anybody had ever reached out to try and help, so I decided to be truthful. I thanked her for offering to listen, and explained that I had never shared this with anybody else, so I might struggle to fully express myself. She wa understanding, and told me to take a much time a I needed. I wa very careful not to unload everything on her, I basically told her exactly what I said at the start of this post that I struggle with depression and anxiety, and that it is been getting a lot worse recently. Initially, it seemed like it wa going well. She had several follow-up questions, some of which I wa not entirely comfortable answering. However, for the first time in year I felt a genuine sense of hope, and felt like someone actually cared about me, so I answered them anyway. Eventually, she asked me what wa causing all of this. I explained that while there are certainly thing that contribute to my depression on a day-to-day basis, at the root of it, there is not really a reason. It is just who I am, almost a if it is hardwired into my brain. It is hard to explain. Do any of you understand what I am talking about? Anyway, this is where thing took a turn. While I wa trying to explain that, she stopped me and said I am sorry, I cannot do this. I offered to help cause I thought you were just having girl problems, or school problems, or something. I did not realize you were totally emo. We are not in high school anymore. Besides, you are a guy, just toughen up . That last part stung. I knew that wa a common sentiment in our society, but to hear it coming from her, someone I have been friend with since high school, really took me by surprise. I did not know what to say, so I did not say anything. I just kind of looked down at my lap. We sat quietly for a moment, until she got up and started gathering her things. As she started to walk away I said I am sorry if I made you uncomfortable, I wa not trying to do that. She looked back at me and said Look, a big reason I am friend with you is because of your positive attitude. It is infectious, and I love that about you. But if that is really just a mask, then you should probably just keep the mask on if we are going to continue being friends. , and then she left. She texted me a few hour later and said I hope you are able to move past your issue so our friendship can move forward . I have not responded, and do not plan to. I cry myself to sleep at night enough a it is without also worrying about maintaining a fake personality for her. I probably will not be opening up to anyone like that again anytime soon except, of course, to all of you wonderful people on the internet . Deep down, I know that most of the people in my life would not react the way she did. But I just do not think I can build up the motivation to try it, not when I struggle just to get up in the morning. I want to thank you all again. Not just for reading my story, but for being a part of this community. Depression and anxiety really suck, and nobody should have to suffer through them alone. ..I am gonna go hug my pillow now.

Whenever I try to change my life these thought pop up Had depression and anxiety for year and have many time tried to make change to my life. But I cannot shake the thought that say why bother? . Why suffer through all that extra pain that change requires just for a long shot chance of a normal life? . And on top of that I do not even know if I want a normal life! I Often think that the only thing that separate myself from the normal people in lack of a better word, is that the normal people have an easier time fooling themselves, a bigger capacity for self-delucions. And if happiness can only come from convincing yourself of existential lies, I am not sure if that happiness is for me.. Has anyone else struggled with these thoughts? Does anyone know how to motivate yourself to change when it seems so futile?

Fast forward to today several week without and I feel like i am having a mental breakdown over every single thing, i am a year old man and have broken down cry multiple time in the past week and have been getting increasingly angry and even violent in some cases. I wa kept waiting too long in a lobby at my apartment for mail and I ended up telling the employee to go fuck themselves and ended up throwing a chair. This is all very interesting considering I got on this and xanax because i couldnt even order food wothout having a nervous breakdown. Another instance is when I stubbed my toe and proceeded to trash my entire fucking apartment and even took a machete to my fridge Dont fucking quit cold turkey. I thought I could handle it but I definitely cant. I just hope this end soon. I honestly feel like i am losing it entirely

I also started feeling anxiety for the first time in my life and suicidal thought are uncommon Ive lost about pound in month because of this. My grade also took a hard hit, going from a . gpa every semester to a .. On mobile at least the official app on Android , long-press the message and a report option will pop up. If you post or comment and then get a chat request or PM that appears similar to the description here, please let u know . If you get a PM or Chat after posting here promoting an amateur self-help blog at either mentorself.com or mentorself.wordpress.com, please be aware that this person appears to be broadcast spamming everyone who post here. Why is it so hard to just be empathetic? Today, I failed miserably at baking a key lime pie. Filling wa way too loose, meringue would not whip, crust cracked, just a terrible time overall. And then my mom come over and instead of comforting me or something a normal human being would do, say Better luck next time, with the tone of a carny trying to get a six year old away from his ring toss booth. I got even more upset, and that seemed to genuinely confuse her. All I wanted in that moment wa for her to say I am sorry your pie did not turn out, it will be okay. Or just something a human being with emotion would say to their upset daughter. This even just kind of exemplified what I get sick of in people. Even if you do not get it why is it so hard to realize that people have different priority from you? Especially people who are depressed or have other mental illnesses. It can be a triumph for u to get out of bed some days. If we share an achievement or more rarely a failure with you, be with u in that emotion for a moment. Why is that so hard for normal people? Oh yeah. Because all the empathetic people are depressed.

I have made several attempt at it but then sometimes I think I do not really want to die I just want this life to get better. Some people have normal life do not they? Why do they have normal lives, and what the heck is wrong with me? Why cannot I just snap out of it someday and be someone productive!?!?! I HATE MYSELF, I hate the way I have made my life. I want a job that say I matter, I want to rewind and start over knowing what I know now! RANT RANT RANT - I hate life!

Doctor taking me off med Cold Turkey Hi everyone, I have been on Prozac Fluexetine since th grade. I am a nd year student in college now. For the past few year I have been upped from mg, to mg, and now mg. I have been on mg for years. When I went to my doctor it wa only to tell him during a check up that I wa comfortable with my medicine and dosage, so he would send more prescription to my pharmacy. During my last visit, I expected it to be a quick and simple check up a usual, but instead he said he wa prescribing me more month of mg Prozac then making me stop cold Turkey because being on Prozac for more than month is bad . I do not understand because he ha been constantly renewing my prescription for year and never said anything about tapering off or stopping. I once went a month cold turkey during a health insurance issue and around the rd week I had attempted suicide. And addressing the month he promised, I wa quickly informed the pharmacy wa only given month of medicine for me I have been admitted to a mental hospital by my mother after I got raped and beaten, because I drank a lot of alcohol for a few days. I have been to several therapists. I have been rationing my pill every days, and my mother and fianc e who I live with have already seen a drastic change in my behavior. I feel awful because they give me such a nice and comfortable life but I am still depressed. I do not know what to do when I have no more antidepressant after year and then going cold Turkey. I am afraid my brain chemistry will convince me to do something stupid and damaging to myself again.

Ok, so i have had depression for at least year and it ha gotten a lot worse the past two. My mom tried shoving prozac down my throat and swore that it helped me, but it did not. I did not talk to a counselor until about a month a go. I wa going to school and every time i went to main campus i would get Ds and Fs. I would start out ok but then end up sleeping more and more. This past quarter i physically could not get out of bed at one point. My parent just saw it a me blowing my last chance at college and took it a i did not care. It seems like i do not feel anymore. I do care that i blew my last chance at college and i finally decided to see a counselor week before the end of the quarter. My parent said the only reason i did that is because i knew i wa in trouble and just needed an excuse. I do not know why i do not do the thing i know i should be doing. I just feel like i cannot. My parent say it is all my fault, that i do not take responsibility for anything and I just want to blame everything on something else. Which is not the case. They do not think that depression ha anything to do with not trying, that it doe not affect rational decision making. I am starting to think it doe not either. I mean, why cannot i do the thing i know I am suppose to do? The thing that will better my life. The thing that will make my parent proud? Is it the depression or am I truly lazy and just do not care?? Because everything my parent are saying is making me think it really is just me and i do not have depression.

I have been reading the hoarding thread in the OCD forum and I am jealous. They are having fun bonding by sharing story about their habits, so I thought we could do some of that with plain old depressives. Sometimes when I am depressed, I realize that I am cry over something so stupid that I have to step back and laugh at how upset I have gotten over dumb things. I cannot remember all of them, but here are some of the highlight on the list of Silly Things That Made Starry kitten Cry -my boyfriend told me his cat wa giving me a mean look . I set out a pack of Marshmallow Peeps to get nice and crispy in the open air and my roommate threw them out. oh, there were tears! . The coffeehouse wa out of soymilk on a day I really wanted some soy hot chocolate What is on your list?

Everything is just been hard to deal with lately.. I do not really know how to start this, since I am kind of new to this subreddit, and reddit in general, but I guess I will try to say this all without embarrassing myself or something of the sort. I do not feel any pressure to be doing well at study anymore, but I do have one friend who does, and occasionally, he will ask for space or something during stressful time so that he doe not end up lashing out at me, but now, it is just making me feel incredibly lonely. I hate having to watch everyone else give hug and stuff and just have a good time with their friend while I just keep having to give my friend space. I get that we put this in place to avoid having feeling hurt, but now it just feels.. restrictive? It is all kind of hard to describe coherently, and my mind feel all jumbled up, tbh. I just really want a hug at this point so i can stop feeling.. well, lonely..

I really do not know what to do. I have suffered with depression for the past years. It come and go with treatment. I thought i wa over stuff but over the last little while it ha got really bad again. I feel so low, so low and i cannot pick myself up. I am drifting away from everyone, they all enjoy going to the pub etc and i hate being with load of people and i do not drink so i do not go out. They have given up on me now. I hate my job. That brings me down so much. I work for the ambulance service taking call and i cannot deal with the pain and suffering of everyone anymore. A year old girl died the other day whilst i wa on the phone and it is just not fair. I just cannot deal with stuff anymore. I feel alone, i am dull and boring, in debt and i just cant see the point anymore. The only thing keeping me afloat, and i really feel like I am hanging on by the skin of my teeth is my boyfriend he is the only thing i live for and he is bound to dump me. It is like a vicious circle. I am incredibly insecure and he will get fed of it and dump me. If he dump me that will be it there will be nothing. I think about it all the time. I want time off so i can just be on my own but I am screwing up my chance of finding another job so i can get away from this one. I do not know what to do. I am seriously thinking about ending it all and i do not know how to pick myself up.

Just ranting. It fucking annoys me when I tell someone I am depressed and they say why. Like, when someone tell you they have the fucking flu do you ask why? How are people so dumb about mental illness? I have people who say yeah, I wa depressed before, and I am like what did you do and they say it just went away. Seriously? You just woke up and it wa fucking gone? Poof? Everyone always ha their golden fix for me too. My mom tell me to drink lemon water. My dad say stop worrying so much. My coworker say meditate. Exercise. Volunteer. Quit your job and go do what you love which is what, exactly? . I try so, so, so hard to not be depressed. But if I am not pushing myself to stop it, it come back, and I am back to square one. And I cannot, I just cannot keep doing it. It is just like pushing a rock up a mountain with no peak. My favorite are the people who say you need to let go. Just let go of the past. These are the people that post dumbass quote on Facebook and Instagram who have not experienced a day of depression in their lives. Let go of WHAT? What doe that even fucking mean? I ask these people to go into detail, and they do not. They act like a fucking monk, and just say, You just have to let go. All of those people can go fuck themselves.

I am New to this site, I wa diagnosed with SLE Lupus about eight month ago and i am on very strong treatment using predinsone. Everyone around me noticed it first I guess since I wa suddenly so quiet, moody and would cry at the drop of a hat. Which, wa so unlikely of me I used to crack joke laugh and my goal wa always to have fun and make other is laugh. But since my diagnosis and medication which I counted and i am taking like almost pill a week and I just turned yesterday, honestly i would never thought i would be in this state at a few year ago Anyway I never wanted to admit it, depression is not only a symptom of lupus but it is a side effect of the medication a well, and I think that it is a general first reaction to being told that you have an incurable disease. But I finally am starting to see it now I think that i am really depressed. I wa never a quiet girl but now i am so quiet that I think i am scaring everyone. but now i am living with my wonderful boyfriend who seems to understand everything so well and is so patient with me. But I just need a place where I can talk this out with people who understand.

I feel sad. It is . am and I have not gone to bed yet. Instead I am sitting here at the computer half heartedly trying to be part of the chat room, tear falling down my face. I feel so sad I cannot even be bothered to reach for my phone to remove the razor from the back, or go down stair for a bottle of wine. It make me feel worse that this is been going on for so long that even the pathetic depressive coping skill have no effect on me. Pure pessimism, not even the chance of some temporary relief through an OD or spilt blood. Why did they seem to offer relief , , year ago? I tried to eat normally today, I really tried. I failed though. I am trying to see myself properly, or at least come to the realization that I am not vile and unattractive, and obese. It still end up with food all over the toilet. I disgust myself so much. I disgust myself because I let myself eat. I disgust myself because I think a I do, and I know that eating should be considered normal, but I cannot see it like that. I disgust myself because I covered the toilet bowl in bit of chewed up food and stomach acid. I do not know what to say any more. I wish some one would say that I am going to feel better, but I have had that for the last years, and I would probably just be cynical any way. This post wa pathetic, I am sorry. Ruth

Only cigarette today This sound really stupid but I have never ever practiced self control with smoking and I usually smoke anywhere from to cigarette a day. Does anyone else live inside their head ? Hi, this is my first ever post. I feel like I am living in my head of the time. I catch myself forming conversation in my head between me and other people. It is pretty obvious because my lip move and I tend to smile when this happens. A couple of my friend have pointed this out Sometimes, the conversation are just between me and myself. I feel very numb during this whole process. The topic of these conversation revolve around feeling worthless in every aspect. It feel like life is against me. I am average in every way looks, intelligence, skill . I feel like I will never amount to anything. I just do thing to get them over with, just so that I can continue to keep to myself and get stuck in my head like this. I do not have pride in any non-school school project or assignment I do. Even thing that should be enjoyable, like going out with friend doe not really do anything for me. It feel a if nothing brings me joy, except numbing myself out from everyone else.

Today is my st birthday. I am spending it alone with a bottle of wine. Birthdays have always been a bit of a sore spot for me. To quote a very old comment of mine, th birthday I had just been let out of a mental hospital a few day before. My mother find out she ha a brain tumor. My only friend at the time get sick and go home early. th birthday All my friend but one bail on me. My parent scream at each other until my mother pack up and leaves. th birthday My family and I go out to dinner to a restaurant that my dad chose solely because he had a coupon for it and buy the world is smallest birthday cake. Halfway through my birthday celebration the following weekend my friend abandon me due some drama bullshit that wa apparently more important than me. th birthday Dad start an argument in the middle of a restaurant in front of my best friend. After we get home, the argument continues, resulting in my dad physically attacking my mother. All while my friend and I sat in my bedroom. To add to that, my friend is mother died of a heart attack on my th birthday, and I spent my th alone due to the fact that all of my old high school friend had moved on and my best friend had decided to join the military. Well, today wa my st. My best and only friend completely forgot about me. My dad then made me have an emotional meltdown. Now it is nearly midnight and my only company is the nearly empty bottle of wine sitting next to me, so I am not only sad, but also slightly drunk. Happy birthday to me.

I have been dealing with severe depression for sometime now, and within recent week it ha hit it worst most of my post were in the MNSEN area lack of sleep, stress, behind on my work, cannot leave my apartment, constant crying, hopeless need, etc. And during these few week I have taken the step into getting into regular therapy again by consulting psych service at my school in conjunction with the counseling I get or hardly ever get from my hospital. The severity of my depression ha been taking a toll on my friend and last night it seemed to reach it pinnacle. I am not sure what came over me, I wa not even drunk, but I started lashing out at a friend of a friend that wa at the same party a I was. I started to verbally bully and attack him because he annoyed me, I do not know why I have so much pent up anger. It rapidly went out of control and before I know it my friend were holding me back and I violently threatened them. For the first time in my life, my best friend closest friend had to physically hold me against a wall, almost hitting me, to get me to come down. I just broke down after that, it wa not even about that stupid guy anymore. I wa suddenly overcome with loneliness and fear an jealousy and embarrassment. I have always been known for a very short temper, and my friend all know me to be very emotional, but I have never gotten so violent I have hit and thrown object before in anger and frustration but I have never struck someone. Though they all tried to console me that night, I feel even farther away from the few friend that I do have. Everything wa hazy from last night, even though I had hardly any to drink.. it wa not so much of an intoxication, but more like a violent breakdown of sorts. I wa so angry and I wa desperate to physically hurt someone it wa quite a scene since I am a petite girl starting a fight with a passive aggressive ft male--some laughed it off at first a a Napoleon Complex, but it became serious when they saw how out of it I was. I just remember being so hurt and angry at my friend I felt so alienated which fueled my anger at the world, at my life more.. As cliche a that sound . And today I just do not feel like going out and I cannot help but feel so alone. The way my friend violently had to restrain me scared me a lot--I have never seen her like that, and she is certainly not the type to behave like that.. I pushed her to that point. It brought me back to an ex-bf of mine that I wa very close too and who saw the worst of my depression a well he too at one point had to restrain me violently against his character a well . After an off and on relationship of trying to stay together, he could not take me, or my emotional instability, anymore. Last night, I had friend breaking down screaming at me that they were never enough for me to make me happy or content otherwise and it just brought me back to that moment with my ex. I feel a if that this cycle is in all my relationships--romantic one and friendships. I seem to constantly push people away. I do not know what to do. I do not miss my ex-bf at all, but I am scared that I will never be able to have close relationship friendships. Everyone I know just pity me. I feel so completely alone and pathetic.

Am I Depressed? While I have been distraught and suicidal on and off since age fifteen, I have never been formally diagnosed with anything because I do not trust the mental-health establishment. I have only visited a shrink twice once when forced by parents, a second time when pressured by a partner. Because of this, I am reluctant to claim I am depressed except in the loose, colloquial sense. Instead, I feel my rage and despair flow quite appropriately from my failure to fulfill my desires, achieve my dreams, and so on. I hate being alive and would adore a sudden death, sure, but that doe not necessarily mean I am depressed, right? I do not experience many of the symptom of formal depression I sleep pretty well most of the time, I eat okay, and I am socially active. I feel abjectly isolated, but empirically I spend a fair amount of time with friendly acquaintance at event and so on. I resist the medical model of my mental state because it assumes the problem is with me rather than with the world. I figure I would be okay if I had the basic level of social success normal folk have a number of close friend and a healthy romantic sexual relationship with one or more partners. I am becoming increasingly confident my genetics and value combine to make forming meaningful connection with other human effectively impossible. Because I yearn for such connection intensely, it is only rational that this dynamic would make my life unlivable. I am not depressed. My brain ai not malfunctioning it is a valid a pattern a any. The uncaring universe approves of my mind a much a anyone is. I am just not biologically equipped to thrive in the environment I find myself in.

I just drove mile cause my Gma tried to OD and is in ICU. IDK if this belongs here. Maybe it will get removed, but I feel like I need to vent somewhere. My grandma ha struggled with manic depression a lot through her life. I have always seen her a this strong independent woman. She ha always been my favorite family member because just how kind and loving she is toward everyone and everything. No matter how bad life ha ever gotten for me or anyone else she ha always had positive words. Well I never knew it but she is a bottler and my dad told me in the s she snapped and try to OD roughly year ago. Combination with anxiety and stress and lot of other factors. Keep in mind everyone love this woman she ha granddaughter and grandson and loving kids. This woman is a saint in my family. He we are year later again. My family and I live in Texas, meanwhile they live in Georgia and my dad sister gmas daughter and her family live in Virgina. My aunt plan to move back to TX. So my grandparent were planning to move to TX since everyone on the East Coast is leaving. When it came down to sign on a Realtor she snapped I guess again.. These are people in there s trying to uproot their life again and move across country. She tried to OD on some pill and my dad, sister, and I hopped in the car yesterday and drove from Tx to Ga. My Gpa said he noticed she wa eating le but did not see the signs. Now we surprised her and did not tell her we were coming. Amongst other family all were happy to see us. My Gma I could tell wa not the rock solid woman I always known her to be. It made me realize that you can be yo and still have these dark thought and try. She looked so weak and frail. So here I am in a different time zone trying to support my gma the best I can. My sister doe not even know, she just think she is isick . This woman ha all the love in the world and that still doe not help dark thoughts. IDK how I feel, I do not know how I am coping. It ha not hit me yet I think.. Also my Gpa literally would not survive without her. Like she is the one that make sure bill are paid on time and basically run the house. She is his guide and he would be lost and a wreck without her. Hes so shaken up and worried. On top of everything my girlfriend just tried the same thing but a different method and her brother called the cop and she got would and I have talked her once in days. When she called I had just learned about my gma and I feel like she did not get the support she needed from me. It break my soul to think that this loving amazing person would want it to go all away and leave all of u behind. I have so many cherished memory of my grandparents. Sometimes I feel like I can get these stint of depression and I know it run in the family. So here is me unbottling to you guy in hope to here thoughts, prayers, and reddit love.

In love, I am full of goals, ideas, glass half full, my bank account may be low, but it doe not effect me. I can deal with anything while in love. I am more confident while in love.
